description:
Heard great things about Regalito Rosticeria so I had to try it. Also, I always noticed the building due to its color and wording. I had the 1/2 chicken which came with rice and beans. The chicken had great flavor covered in a delicious sauce. I also liked the rice and beans, but unfortunately it was cold. I'm not sure if that was intended or someone in the kitchen made a booboo. Also there was little rice and bean. After three bites, my rice and beans were all gone. Very small proportion for the rice and bean. Service was great, quick and friendly. 

Check out my picture...
author: Anita T.

description:
I really wanted to love it here because I can literally see the restaurant from my front door. Unfortunately, we won't be back.

The service was very attentive most of the night. There never seemed to be one dedicated server per table, which was a bit confusing, and led to our dinner plates sitting in front of us for a while at the end. However, everyone was friendly and helpful.

The food was not fresh and overcooked. The guac came out within two minutes of ordering it so clearly not freshly made, despite the bowls of avocados sitting out on top of the bar. The tostadas were like cardboard pucks; stale with zero flavor. I had the enchilada verde, which was fine but not great. The chicken was a bit dry. My boyfriend had the pork which was borderline inedible. Way overcooked and super dry. I tried to save the meal by ordering churros for dessert. They came out burnt. 

Very disappointing all around.
author: Erica G.

description:
This is one of my favorite spots. I'm so happy they have brunch now! Their ingredients are really fresh, handmade tortillas, homemade soups, fresh squeezed Oj, fresh avocado, great spices 

For dinner the chicken is still my fav, I love their greens, and husband loves all the dishes. Be sure to let them know ahead of time if you have allergies to queso or crema. I think you can even order burritos on the bar menu now. Great quality meats too. Long family style table on the patio outback and regular tables and bar inside ... great open kitchen !
author: Coco J.

description: Food is so friggin good! I am so happy I stumbled upon this place. What a sweet little gem. I came here on a Saturday evening, about 7 pm, and this place was practically empty. I was promptly seated upon my arrival, which I was very pleased with. I started my dinner off with a nice simple house margarita, which was pretty tasty. I ordered some chips and salsa, as I was super hungry, and needed something to quiet my stomach as I awaited my meal. For my entree, I ordered the Pollo Regalito (1/2 chicken), which came with a few tortillas, rice, and beans. The tortillas served were so delicious and fluffy; you can tell they used fresh ingredients to make their tortillas. After a few bites, I was stuffed. You definitely get your money's worth here! I highly recommend stopping by this place, if you are in the area. Very great experience.
author: Alexus S.

description:
I don't know why this place is rated so low!
It was tasty and good. Small menu. Maybe a little pricey. But good!
author: Tim W.

description: Excellence in Mexican dining! Could not be better food or service. We had reservations for 5:30. We were greeted warmly, sat down for drinks, and were not bugged to order quickly. Our server did keep an eye on us, but not in an intrusive way. The cuisine was fancy,  but tremendous flavor. Not cheap, but not overly expensive. Good selection of wine at reasonable prices.
author: Pat H.

description: Friendly, clean and good food. We had an event here. Painting in the backyard - supercool!
author: Mike T.

description: Just hosted a friend's birthday here. The family style table in the covered patio was perfect for the evening. And the staff was great to work with.
author: Christopher P.

description: I love Regalito so. The people that run this place and Eduardo himself are real gems. The scale and atmosphere are perfect and the food is amazing.
author: Drew P.

description: Food is above average, great authentic Mexican cuisine. Staff is friendly, knowledgeable and there to help. Decor is thoughtful without pretension. Great Sangria, I will be back!
author: Daniel M.

description:
El regalito was very good. It is a very discrete building in the  mission, grey with yellow accents and very contemporary symbols. It has two, two seaters outside and bright yellow/lime doors. The best part of coming in was one, escaping the cold, but the attendants were so accommodating and happy. They also got along really well and kept the restaurant going. The menu is pretty limited, which is nice. It had a nice selection of entrees, including vegetarian options. The wine selection was surprisingly extensive, given that their menu was not.the dessert list was limited to 4-5 but they all sounded delicious.

As an appetizer we got the papas con chorizo. This plate was so good and such a good starter plate. The best way to describe it is an ounce or two of chorizo cradled by a bed of crispy roasted potatoes and topped by crema and pico. Make sure to ask for hot sauce. IT IS SO HOT! But it does bring some nice notes on the chorizo and potato seasoning. I had a super burrito as my main entry. This just means crema and abocado are added to the normal burrito. The torilla was perfect! Extremely thin an crisp. The chicken was nicely seasoned and the rise was not overpowering. The slices of avocado gave it a very fresh taste that was accentuated by the cream. My friends ordered the chiles verdes and the tinga de pollo. I am not of fan of stewy plates but the ting was actually very refreshing. The chiles verdes were so good! I was impressed by the presentation and the balance between all the elements.
author: Emmanuel T.

description: I loved this restaurant! I'm so happy we stumbled upon it. It's classy and the food is delicious! The atmosphere is so easy going, the service was great and the food was unexpectedly delicious! I got the Enchiladas verdes and I absolutely loved it. The sauce was perfect and the plating was spectacular. All the food was fresh & filling without making me have to go directly to the bathroom after eating t. Such a unique and classy Mexican experience. Will be coming back for sure!
author: Kenzie C.

description: The food and prices were average, though the chicken was quite bland despite it's beautiful plating. Would have given them a three star but feel they should step up their game a bit if they're going to advertise that they are Michelin recommended.
author: Kimberly H.

description: Food is ridiculously over priced. Service was great though. (Eduardo) 7/24 Very attentive and polite. I didn't even know this place had a michelin star recommendation but honestly wouldn't go back to eat any entrees. The tacos dorados and Chicharrones and drinks will be all I order next time, everything else is not worth it. My mole was less than subpar, i constantly had to add salt to it, rice was also bland. Definitely not your authentic mexican restaurant so don't come here if you're looking for that!
author: Griselda P.

description: Without the service and atmosphere I would've given 1 star. The service was great but the margaritas and food were 3/10 at best. The half chicken was actually the worst piece of chicken I've ever had in my life, it was left cooking for probably 30 minutes too long and laughably dry. We passed it around the table so everyone could try how bad it was.. if I wanted good service and bad tasting food I could've just cooked for myself and spared the $75 we each spent.
author: Katherine C.

description: You guys have an authentic spot! By that I mean your barbacoa is on point. I can't stop bragging about it! After I was done eating, I wanted to get some more! Customer service was friendly too.
author: Hector M.

description: This is my second time going to Regalito. First time I remember the green enchiladas , rice and beans were delicious!!! I even remember meeting some friends and the staff was so kind to accommodate me and my fiancé in fitting us at the table. I made reservations Friday night and I made a phone call to add one more guest. They were so nice and kind! When we showed up , I felt the staff was just so nice ! It's refreshing to feel welcomed and taken care of! Food was great as well as the customer service! I recommend making reservations as you know things get packed in the City.
author: Kristi P.

description:
Regalito is truly a gift.  Its atmosphere, especially in the garden room with the largest bird of paradise plant I've ever seen is wondrous.

The food is prepared with delicacy and precision.  Everything from appetizers to the mains (which change) are excellent and tasty.  What is really memorable is how everything is fragrant with the natural taste of the ingredients and the fresh spices and herbs.  This is everything from entrees to the rice to the dessert.

They have one of the best flans I've ever had.  What was really exceptional was the copious amounts of real vanilla.

Truly a great restaurant!
author: V L.

description: We made a last minute reservation on Open Table but we were seated at the bar because there were really no tables. The food, however, was excellent. I was able to wstch the woman who just made fresh tasting tortillas all day. The tres leche cake was to die for so fresh (the waiter told me they just made it). I would recommend this place to anyone especially if you are coming from the East coast! Try the chicken mole and the chicken verde.
author: Maria M.

description:
We love Regalito! My husband is from Mexico so we're hard to please when it comes to Mexican food. But, after trying many of their dishes, we chose Regalito for a private party celebrating an important anniversary. 
The Regalito team took care of every guest like family and the food was delicious!   
Our guests loved the space (gorgeous patio too), and every one commented on the good feeling at Regalito. This is the Mission feeling we love!
author: C V.

description: REAL MEXICAN FOOD. Fresh food, good portions, good flavors, hand made tortillas, options for everyone (including vegetarian), good service.
author: Diane Q.

description: Fresh delicious savory Mexican food in the heart of mission. They have steep competition because there are 5 amazing spots around the corner but what distinguishes this gem is the backyard garden (for the mommas out there) and the food is super fresh and interesting combos..I love the veg burrito!
author: Laurie J.

description:
Excellent brunch menu and food. I highly recommend the breakfast burrito. My friend got the chilaquiles and was the best she has had. Amazingly friendly service. I'll be back frequently!

The spicy salsa is awesome as well - just be aware that it is SPICY!
author: Kirk C.

description:
Bomb mimosas, as in biggggg.

Not a big fan of many things on their menu, but have a couple of faves. 

Ask for the Xmas chilaquiles. Your mauf shall party.

The enchiladas? Righteous.

They need to up their salsa game tho.

Rice and beans? Solid.

For dessert, order the churros with hot chocolate (as in cocoa). Most places serve you busted frozen churros. Not these guys. They're so fresh they taste soft and creamy on the inside, like the kind you get on a random corner in downtown Tijuana. That mean something to you? It should.
author: Gabriela W.

description: Came here for dinner and loved it. Had the chicharrón, rotisserie chicken and the mole and they were all fantastic! Good margaritas and good tortillas, and the people were very nice; great service. Would definitely go back.
author: Corinne W.

description:
If you are looking for healthy yet authentic Mexican food, this is the place to come! 

The tortillas are hand made, and the food is light yet super satisfying. Great veggie options (chile relleno etc), and all the meat is free range and antibiotic free. 

They also have an adorable outside patio, perfect for sunny days, yet covered if it's raining.

YUM!
author: Hannah W.

description: I am so happy we decided to try Regalito, the entire staff was outstanding. The food and drinks were outstanding.  I wish the steak had a little larger portion, but we did have a voucher and can not complain, best service in San Francisco so far.
author: Dee D.

description:
We came across Regalito Rosticeria while wandering around Mission District and we decided to try it with our 6 months puppy. We sat outside (in front of the restaurant, not in the backyard). They were absolutely adorable with us, bringing water for our dog and being really accommodating regarding our many questions. I had a carnitas burrrito with extra avocado and sour cream and it was really good! My husband went for the vegetarian option and really enjoyed it too.

The staff was very friendly and nice, they offered excellent advice :-) We'll go back there!
author: Caroline P.

description:
How I wish I could tell you about the food at  Regalito.

I arrived here with four friends. They took 20 minutes to get our order. After an hour we told them we had not been served and after some confusion confessed they needed to take our order again so we had to leave.

I would never venture in here again. It's not just the delay but how they handled it. Regalito means "gift" in Spanish - which I would consider false advertising.
author: D Z.

description: Way too much lime!!! First, drinks were really good. The mojito is good and strong (like 18% strong). The beer selection was good but they don't have draft beers. We didn't order any appetizers and went straight for the entrees. The corn tortillas are homemade and are really good. The roast chicken in the enchiladas wasn't bad, there wasn't anything about it that put it over the top though. The tomatillo sauce would've been so good if it wasn't for all the lime. After a few bites it was too much and I couldn't finish my meal. Also I'm pretty sure we should've gotten rice and beans with our entrees and none of us got it. This place was not worth the price. However, the service was great and the location is perfect in the mission. I would only come back here for the drinks.
author: Lisa D.

description: They make the tortia's by hand and they flavor and taste is there.  We stopped by and had the hand made guacamole the tortia's, fish tacos and soup with steak.  We also had there famous margaritas.  Actually we had 8 of them and it was a wonderful dinner.  Very cleanplace.  Staff are extremely nice.  Spent 3 hours there with great food and friends.  I say check it out.
author: Zeke L.

description: Excellent family-style Mexican with a refreshing upgrade to the usually dirty taqueria. Must haves here include the guacamole and tostado chips as well as a go with their margarita. The enchiladas verdes are an excellent choice for main and will deliver with tasty green sauce and tender chicken. For the more adventurous, try the pollo mole, or split the above. Better yet, get a group to share everything and throw in the famed chili rellenos and carne con chile Colorado. Important to support family places like this, and they do indeed do well with a group. ¡Muchas gracias!
author: Brian J.

description: Very happy with my dinner tonight! The ensalada de nopales was bright and flavorful. The cochinita pibil was extremely tender, and their enchiladas verdes were very flavorful.
author: Kyle D.

description: Authentic and fresh! We had a few different tacos and the chicharones. We were so pleased to have stumbled upon this place and can't wait to go again. Prices were fair, service was on point.
author: Disco B.

description: I had dinner here a few days ago and this place never disappoints. We started off with a michelada which was mixed just the way I like them. We also had the guacamole and chips which is also amazing. I had the green chile enchiladas and those were so delicious as well. Service was great and I would definitely recommend this place in the Mission.
author: Norm T.

description: Fish tacos are delicious! Carne assada was amazing as well. Great ambiance, very nice staff! Pastel de Tres leches for desert is definitely a must order. Definitely recommend this place!
author: Gabriel M.

description: GREAT authentic Mexican food! Francisco the server provided GREAT and humorous service!
author: Alberto G.

description: Amazing good. Even better service. I love the atmosphere and how delicious everything on the menu is. I reserved the large back patio for my birthday and it was such a great evening. Thank you Francisco!
author: Allison H.

description:
Last year before I left my office permanently after 40+ years of working for the State of California, my co-workers gave me a farewell luncheon, many wonderful gifts, written kind words (to the point of humbling me and bringing tears of happiness to my eyes) and a Groupon coupon for Regalito Rosticeria.  It was dinner for two for my husband and me to enjoy.  I have never used a Groupon coupon before and this was my first time.

Before I continue writing this review, I want to especially thank Lionel (my co-worker) who suggested this restaurant.  I wasn't too sure if I wanted to be in the Mission district in the late evening.  There was that certain fear and worry about the Mission being as dangerous as Downtown Oakland/Broadway.  It was not at the time, and shame on me for holding such a stereotypical view.

Our reservation was for 6:30, and we arrived at 6:15.  Parking was not easy because the streets were filled with parked cars, but we found a spot on 19th Street (close to Mission Street).  

Ernesto, our waiter, explained (as stated on the coupon) that for $30.00 we could order one appetizer, two dinner entrees and one dessert.  Beverages are extra and not included.

Appetizer:  4 Taquitos filled with chicken and topped with queso, crema and cilantro.  I was warned that the salsa was very spicy and it was (for me, muy caliente).  My husband enjoyed them with the salsa and lime.  4 stars

Entree #1:  Tinga pollo with chipotle sauce and avocado salsa.  Accompaniment - seasoned Mexican rice.  Husband said it was delish.  5 stars

Entree #2:  Enchiladas Verdes - three corn tortillas dipped in salsa verde and chicken, garnished with crema, queso fresco and onions (ceballos).  Accompaniment - whole pinto beans.  I was impressed with my choice.  The free-range chicken was fresh and the pinto beans cooked to perfection...not undercooked and not mushy.  5 stars

The warm thick corn tortillas were wonderful.  Forget the ones that I buy in a pack from the supermarket.  

Agua fresca:  Jamaica...tasty and refreshing...delicate hibiscus flavor...not artificial.  4 stars

Dessert:  The choices were flan, churros with Mexican hot chocolate or torta de tres leches with strawberries.  I wanted the sponge cake with strawberries, but they were out.  I opted for the flan, and the two waiters who served us comped us with churros and Mexican hot chocolate.  The flan was not overly sweet and they did not drown the flan with caramel sugar.  The churros were absolutely the "bomb" - freshly prepared and the aroma of cinnamon still in the air.  They were heavenly, dipped in the cocoa and eaten with the flan.  My husband usually does not eat dessert, but this was something special that we both enjoyed.  5 stars

The ambiance was quite charming and we definitely will be back to dine here again.  The service may be a tad slow, but one has to remember that preparation of food of high quality does take time and IMO I believe Regalito aims to please the customers and do things all the way right.  Patience is a virtue; and what's worth waiting is worth getting and that's exactly what we received.
author: Carol C.

description:
Came to this restaurant last week for my wife's 40th.  There were 16 of us, which apparently worked out perfect because it allowed us to have the small (but very quaint) back patio to ourselves.

This was our first visit to this restaurant so I was a bit nervous not really knowing what to expect, especially since it was for a special occasion.

My nervousness diminished quickly shortly after we entered the restaurant.  The ambiance us that of a family style atmosphere.  We were warmly greeted and the staff (especially Edwardo) were very nice and catered to all of our various requests.

We ordered a family style service where we were allowed to choose three main dishes that would be served to the group.  We went with the pozole, chicken mole, and carne tacos.   Let me say, they did not disappoint!   The chef created amazing dishes, they were unique but not crazy different like you wouldn't recognize.  The flavors were truly authentic and very delicious!   The side dishes to complement were also very well done.  The portions were perfect, enough to leave satisfied, but not overwhelming.

The prices are a bit on the higher end, but well worth it if you are looking for a quality dinner.  Bonus is that there is a parking lot right next to the restaurant which most of our group used as parking can be challenging at times in this neighborhood.

All and all, we left very satisfied and had a great time celebrating a birthday at this establishment!
author: Alex K.

description:
Food is okay and personal is nice and efficient. 
Wouldn't go back, though. Way too expensive for the food and the place itself. Place isn't cozy at all - overpriced dishes.
author: Pauline T.

description: I came here with two fiends after the pride parade. I had the Tinga Pollo with chips and guacamole & a beer. It was bomb! Definitely will return to this fun and casual restaurant.
author: Noreen C.

description: If you find yourself hangry and overwhelmed by the food options in the Mission, just stop and eat here. The food is consistently good, the wait is never too long, and the place is never too crowded or loud. It feels like home. You might even want to engage the wait staff for a personal experience. But that's just me.
author: Lina R.

description: Taquitos, cochinita pibil, and my favorite, the chicken mole. All really tasty, great tortilla, good sangria!
author: Paul M.

description: pork belly was super delicious..but the mole was a miss for me...although i did like the chicken regalito..that chicken was super moist and i almost thought for a second it was just as great as limon. service wasn't up to par, forgot to take my order, and got seated at a tiny table. I rather sit at the bar. There's no hard liquor here, only beer and wine, so that was a flop.
author: Minerva L.

description: One of the rare places in the Mission which really deserves 5 stars. Great food,fair prices, 100% health score and great service.
author: Timur A.

description: Great horchata. Food was fresh and really yummy. Nice place to stop by when you're wandering around in the mission!
author: Madeleine F.

description:
Came here on a Saturday evening.

Ambience: Place almost looks like a salad place.  Indoor area is small yet it looked like they had a garden in the back.  Overall appearance was minimalist and modern.

Service: Our waiter was great; attentive. There was no wait to be seated.

Food: The guac here was delish; no complaints here. We had the enchiladas Rojas and Verde and both were quite yummy.

Prices: I guess average for SF.

Overall decent spot.
author: Rosemary V.

description:
This is our neighborhood Mexican restaurant when we want a step above the taqueria's.  The quality of the food is consistent and the service great.   

They've been in the neighborhood for over 10 years.   A little pricey but not bad.  We have dined here many times and never disappointed.
author: Mark S.

description: Shocked by the Michelin star.  Food was mediocre (3 stars at best), but high enough priced to drop this to 2.  I was unimpressed with every dish I had.  Would take a Mission burrito or pastor from a taco truck any day of the week.  Sorry guys, I tried it and wasn't a fan.
author: Foodie G.

description:
Each time I come, I am constantly impressed with my experience. To capture the whole experience, sit in the back rustic addition to the restaurant under heat lamps and share the communal table. This back communal table is perfect for renting out as an intimate dinner party. The staff is always great and their recommendations are spot on (and most of the time an affordable option!). While the portion sizes appear small, each bite is dense with rich spices and tender meat, so beware of over ordering!

Great for groups of all sizes who can take their time appreciating the decor, food, and company of others.

Start the evening with a house margarita or sangria. Then try the Chicharrones (Pork skin cracklings and pork belly - served with salsa fresca and house-pickled carrots and peppers),  the Cochinita Pibil (Slow roasted banana leaf-wrapped, citrus and achiote-marinated pork garnished with habanero pickled red onions) and  Pollo Regalito (Half roast free-range chicken with choice of lemon or chile-garlic marinade served with sauteed green beans or papas fritas). Then stick around for dessert!
author: Regina D.

description:
I've always been curious about this place - I love the colors of their building and they're really visible from Valencia and I love the font they use.. yes I'm a font whore.

Overall the food was good, the service pleasant. But for the price point, you can get much more inexpensive and better Mexican food at those hole-in-the-wall spots all over the Mission. For me, not quite worth the bill at the end of the night, even if my bf was paying =).

And while I'm on the cost: $72 total (incl. tax/tip) for 2 drinks, 2 entrees, & 1 dessert.

They are relatively empty for Sunday dinner, so a good night for walk-ins. We were served by a super friendly old hispanic woman - like the world's friendliest grandma.

* Agave wine margarita - 3.5 stars
Not as sweet as I'd hoped based on agave being in the description, more crisp and refreshing. Not bad, not fantastic. A good glass of wine.

Dinner menu:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/regalito-rosticeria-san-francisco?select=OAOJcAHmccwwVHgCGjL63w#VL09R_r170qXEMZycoUyGg

* Cochinita Pibil - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/regalito-rosticeria-san-francisco?select=7e83iijpB-J7YzpvgI5fOw#COWay9MisWLj3SBWeQ9KZA
(Off-menu item for the night: Slow roasted marinated pork; mine came with black beans, salsa, and homemade tortillas)
The black beans were tasty, though a bit on the hard/undercooked side if I'm being picky. The tortillas were thick and had a good slightly rough/grainy texture, but once again if I'm being picky, they were a bit hard. The pork had a good taste but for something that's slow roasted, it really should've fallen apart easily under my fork and been much softer. 

* Enchiladas Verdes - 3 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/regalito-rosticeria-san-francisco?select=7e83iijpB-J7YzpvgI5fOw#QvCEkeB_mr6moPS-FzdNBA
(Handmade corn tortillas dipped in a tomatillo and green chile sauce filled with roast chicken, garnished w/ queso fresco, crema, onions & cilantro, served w/ rice & beans. $17)
The rice & beans that came on the side were awesome. They mixed well together, had a great flavor, were soft and moist, and could've been its own dish! In general, I'm just not a big fan of salsa verde so I didn't love this. I thought the chicken was also cut into pieces that were too chunky and a bit hard/dry.

Dessert menu:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/regalito-rosticeria-san-francisco?select=OAOJcAHmccwwVHgCGjL63w#OAOJcAHmccwwVHgCGjL63w

* Torta de Tres Leches - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/regalito-rosticeria-san-francisco?select=7e83iijpB-J7YzpvgI5fOw#7e83iijpB-J7YzpvgI5fOw
(Yellow sponge cake w/ three milks and fresh strawberries. $8)
Our slice was topped by one strawberry that didn't seem super fresh. The cake itself is probably one of the better tres leches I've had - moist and fairly dense. A nice way to end the meal!
author: Ziyan C.

description:
"This is so good" - those were the first words my wife said after our food was delivered.

We stopped in for a late lunch today.  While we were driving by my wife noticed the sidewalk sign advertised the pozole.  I found parking a blocks away and we walked back.

When we went in we thought maybe they weren't open because no one was in there at 2:30 in the afternoon. 

She ordered the pozole and I got the enchiladas verdes. Both were excellent.  The Pozole was spicy and flavorful. We compared it to a Pozole made by some family friends and think this was definitely spicier and better.  The enchaladas were also very good and flavorful.  My only issue was that there was quite a bit of sauce on them - I though a little too much.  The beans and rice on the side were also good.  And they supplied a small bowl of habanero salsa if you wanted even more spice (it definitely had a lick to it).  We like it spicy and this met our expectations.

We sat at the counter so we could watch as the prepped for dinner service.   and service was immediate - almost too fast, one minute after getting the menus they were asking us if we were ready to order..  The staff was friendly and courteous - and when we complimented the chef on the Pozole and asked about the recipe, he said he would give it to us the next time we were in.

It was definitely worth the stop and will be back, though with their prices it won't be too often.
author: Jeff H.

description: Good service and nice atmosphere. Food is so-so and incredibly overpriced. $7 for chips and salsa. Talk about an inauthentic Mexican eating experience
author: Doug L.

description: Love it, love it love it.  Delicious authentic Mexican food and excellent service.  Highly recommend!
author: Jordan K.

description: Excellent restaurant for a Sat. afternoon lunch.  Very good Mexican food, and delicious chips and salsa.  Good service and extremely clean restaurant.  Very fresh ingredients.
author: Charlie W.

description:
Was planning to get brunch with a group of friends, but SF people sure love brunch aka every brunch place had an hour wait. And Regalito Rosticeria was across the street with no wait at all. Already hungry, we just walked over and started ordering food. We described this place as a "high end" Mexican restaurant - the prices were a bit high for the usual Mexican food prices.

Guacamole: freshest guacamole I've ever tasted!
Pollo con mole negro: the chicken was aite, but the sauce was good
Stuffed poblano chile: I've never had anything quite like this before, but on point.. definitely a must try here
Enchiladas verdes: wasn't quite memorable
Taquitos de carnitas: was aite, but the tomato salsa they use on top is nice and fresh

The servers were really friendly, but the food was just not up to par with my Mexican food expectations. Sometimes, you just have to go to a run-down and cheap prices restaurant for real good Mexican food! ;)
author: Christine S.

description: Amazing yummy food! Had tacos de birria and  al pastor. Homemade corn tortillas, green salsa, just perfection! Can't wait to come back and try more!
author: Lena M.

description: Excellent Service, bomb guacamole, great ambiance.
author: Mike S.

description:
Bottom line: food was okay, wait time was not.
I came here for lunch today and I was rather unimpressed. I tried once before to eat here, sitting outside with my dog for 10 minutes and nobody ever came out to check on me, so I left. I tried again today and honestly, I wish I hadn't. Since I was on my lunch, I had a timer going so I knew when to head back to work. It took 12 minutes after I sat down before the hostess came over to take my order. Once I ordered, it took nearly 20 minutes to get my meal. The place wasn't so crowded as to justify such a long wait for my food. 

Taste wise, the food was pretty good. I ordered the guac and tostadas and some enchiladas verdes and just had water to drink. The tostadas were nicely crispy and thick and the guac was made fresh to order. The enchiladas were good if a bit small but there were three of them and the chicken was nice and tender. The bill for JUST MYSELF was $28. I know this is Valencia and all, but DAYUM! That was too damn much money for food that took too damn long. I even had to get up and refill my own water because the server never really came back.

I really don't see myself returning to this place unless one of two things happen; either they lower their prices and speed up their service or there is a crazy apocalypse and this is the only remaining restaurant in all of San Francisco.
author: Liz S.

description:
Service - 5/5
Ambience - 5/5 
Location - 5/5 
Food - 3/5 

We came here with a travelzoo deal and had a pretty good meal. The deal was for one app, 2 entrees, and one dessert. 

App - Taquitos - Delish!! probably the best thing we ate 

Entrees - Fish tacos - not my fav but my partner really liked it 
             - Chicken Mole - rice and homemade tortillas served with it was amazing! but the mole was a a bit of a miss for me 

Dessert - Churros with hot cocoa. Need I say more? 

Overall would recommend to a friend.
author: Renee C.

description:
My wife and I "discovered" Regalito after finding a parking place and going to another restaurant that was not open.
How fortunate!
We ordered, and immediately were served our two beers and some home made chips and salsa, with an apology and caution that the chips were just made and HOT.
The salsa was medium-mild to my taste and worked well for both of us.
AND hotter sauce is available.
We shared two items:
Citrus and achiote marinated pork with black beans. Terrific, tender, cooked so most of the fat was gone, hot, and served with 4 hot corn tortillas
A grilled chicken burrito. Nice and hot (with one side crisped up on the grill, nice). Very tasty and with some rice, but NOT a rice burrito with some chicken if you know what I mean.
Yeah, will go back when the urge for Mexican hit again.
author: Wayne S.

description:
Ignore the haters. They are still very good.

Get the COCHINITA PIBIL, POLLO CON MOLE NEGRO, and ENCHILADAS VERDES.

I hadn't been in a year and almost didn't go because of the bad reviews complaining about the cost, but come on guys, there's more to Mexican food than just tacos and burritos.
author: Steven W.

description:
Generally, I choose the places to eat. I mean, I am the one with the shiny gold badge that means.... Sadly, it doesn't mean much in the world of relationships, but y'all are impressed by it, right??

My fiance wanted some Mexican food and suggested we head over to this spot. As we parked and began to walk the beaten path of La Mission, I assumed we were headed for another Taqueria. As we approached the entrance I noticed a really clean restaurant, with semi new chairs and a full bar and an open kitchen. My lovely lady found a gem. 

It was mid afternoon on a bright and sunny SF Sunday, so we decided to sit on the patio. The canopy can be pulled back to allow the sun to sneak in and it's quite nice indeed. 

Food:

Taquitos- Hand rolled and fried to perfection. Excellent crunchiness, tender pollo and served up with that funky cheese Mexican'ts love so much. Very good start. 

Cochinita Pibil- Slow roasted puerco wrapped in banana leaves and oh boy. Absolutely delicious combination of flavors. A lil spicy, a lil tangy, tender and such an amazing dish. Served up with handmade, fresh corn tortillas. 

P.S. to my heat seekers. Ask for the habanero salsa. It's spicy and so dang good!

I wasn't going to write a review for this spot, until I noticed that the Yelp community had them rated as a 3 star spot. I've only been once, so my first experience was a 4 star experience. The service was pretty solid, considering one waiter was working the entire room and he was super nice and super helpful.
author: Hector G.

description:
Unbelievably delicious!!! El Regalito's authentic mexican flavor is elegantly served and the staff provided fast & friendly service... The sangria is fantastic!

When you're mexican, it's not easy to find a good restaurant, but El Regalito is definitely on the list of favorites!
author: Emilio P.

description:
This place was AMAZING!!! It is hidden amongst a cluster of popular restaurants..so we picked the one which the least number of people waiting outside.

I loved the vibe, food and the awesome service we received!! My friends and I were literally wandering around after a pretty successful happy hour and stumbled upon this great little place.

We ordered:

SANGRIA - which tastes like juice and I REALLLLYYYYY liked it!!

Agua Frescos - The MANGO..omg..the mango...

Taquitos de Pollo o de Papas y Queso - which the chef kindly allowed us to try on the house. This was seriously..THE best taquitos I've ever had. A lot of places serve it so greasy..or the chicken is super dry..but this place has it perfected. Definitely appreciated this dish quite a bit.

Carnitas - This was a little dry and tough for my taste, but all of the guys in our group really liked it. I think they just like meat.

I really liked this place and definitely will be finding my way back the next time I'm in the Mission. Hands Down!
author: Jennifer S.

description: My favorite restaurant in SF. The food is always fresh and full of flavor and the ingredients are top notch. Love the feeling of being at home when we eat there. The habanero salsa is amazing
author: Sara B.

description: I'm surprised the ratings aren't higher. Our food was excellent. Fresh salsa, recently made tostadas and my enchiladas were great. We sat in the back near the outdoor patio and there was a charming garden near us.
author: g b.

description:
Our third time to Regalito proved one thing, you can repeat a perfect performance!!! We stopped in this past Sunday after a perfect morning consisting of delicious scones and lattes from Thoroughbread Bakery and a movie at AMC (I admit, I got a kick out of Jurassic World in 3D and Imax).  Only to be followed with the amazing good fortune of finding parking on 18th in the Mission, just before 1:00 (go figure--nearly impossible). 

We were greeted by the kind, gentle and personable hostess who escorted us to our favorite seats at the long, clean and totally accommodating bar.  The countertops decorated with so many limes and avocados--really comfortable and culturally pleasing.  Great music--chair dancing is a must!  The view afforded us the opportunity to watch the chef prepare a Tres Leches cake (we were already hungry, now starving).

We ordered the guacamole and chips, handmade with perfectly ripened avocadoes, onion, cilantro and well, who knows what else, but definitely the perfect splash of lime.  The chips are super unusual, large round discs of fabulously crispy corn flavor-not even a hint of greasiness!  We simply LOVE this dish and wanted more to go!

We also ordered the phenomenally scrumptious pork and beef soft tacos.  We both agree they are the best we have had (and for sure the cutest) in The City--no doubt, no question, no hesitation--the best!  Every bite a triumph!!! Perfect size, shape, ingredients, preparation and presentation--¬Perfecto!  

We love Regalito and can't wait to enjoy the ambiance and food again and again and again.

Four thumbs way up!  SNAP, SNAP, SNAP!!!  A pleasant surprise indeed!!!
author: Jeff P.

description:
We split an order of the Taquitos De Pollo O De Papas Y Queso.  Two were pork and two were vegetarian.  They were tasty but I wouldn't say memorable.  The accompanying salsa had the perfect amount of heat.
I couldn't resist trying their pollo con mole as my main dish because I know that making a mole sauce is really a labor of love.  This particular mole was excellent.  The flavors were complex, rich and fragrant.  I wasn't too happy with the chicken itself.  I'm not a fan of chicken legs on the bone with a bit of thigh meat and skin attached.
The bread pudding for dessert was very good.  It was moist and full of flavor.
Service was friendly, authentic and inviting.
author: Thomas D.

description:
The food way OK bit the service was quite bad. This restaurant is incredibly short staffed on a Saturday.

We had to wait a long time to even get water and the answer if he hostess was that she couldn't take care of us. Finally the waiter helped is when we were about to leave.

Also the water didn't look completely pure, not to mention we almost got served in already used glasses.
author: Leonardo V.

description:
I had the rare opportunity to be in San Fran when the city was emptied out thanks to all the people who go to Burning Man. This allowed me to wander through parts of of the city that I would normally avoid for brunch because of the massive lines.

There were still crowds at some of the more popular places but no lines. I still decided to go off the main streets which brought me to this place. Service was immediately awesome. There's outdoor seating both front and back. The interior is adorable. The margarita = perfect size and amount of tequila. 

This isn't the run of the mill SF taqueria. It's the Mexican equivalent to gourmet (not to be confused with Gourmet Mexican, American style). You also won't find $2 tacos but you will get flavorful dishes that you would find in an upscale restaurant in Mexico.  And for SF, it's not too pricey. My only complaint was I wish I had more food (but doesn't every American want giant portions). Other than that, this is a perfect small place to go. Great for a solo eater.
author: Madeline Y.

description:
I liked this place solely because of the mole sauce. I'm not a fan usually, but theirs is pretty awesome. It's got notes of spices and tanginess to it and served over chicken and rice, it's super yum.
The rest of the food is good- not great. I'd say just OK!
author: Kinjal N.

description:
I took my grandmother, her sister, and my boyfriend here for Valentine's Day because they wanted a low key night with Mexican food. We had a groupon deal which allowed us to get 1 appetizer, 4 entrees, and 1 dessert. 

The service was decent at best. No one was really satisfied with their meals because the food was overly salty and bland, even the guacamole. 

There's much better Mexican food in the Mission, so I won't be coming back here. Save your time and money and go to any of the following: West of Pecos, La Rondalla (not on a game night), or Taqueria Cancun/Pancho Villa for burritos.
author: Ashlyn R.

description: We came here with a groupon, and we still felt like we paid too much.  If it wasn't for the friendly and efficient service I would give it one star.  $17 for a carnitas plate?  With dry and flavorless carnitas (how is that even possible?), an underripe avocado, a few bland beans and not even any rice?  If you have ideas to be an upscale Mexican restaurant (think Nopalito), then you had better deliver on the promise of the decor (lovely) and the menu (expensive).  I am sorry, because somebody obviously has grand ideas here and wanted to create something special, but when it comes down to it it's all about the food, and I am afraid regalito did not deliver the promised gift of deliciousness.  Too bad, but we won't be coming back.
author: Doron A.

description:
Valiant effort. Take your fresh organic ingredients you find at Californian cuisine restaurants, and apply Mexican culinary techniques and flavor to it, and you have this place. Everything tastes very fresh, not to mention well-presented. I was a huge fan of their duck mole that they had for a special that day, as long as my carne asada.

Service was friendly and very on-top-of-things as well. I really like their staff!

Now, here's where I think the restaurant might suffer a bit -- it's just in the wrong neighborhood! All of these fresh ingredients are not cheap, which means that the prices are a bit high for what you would normally expect for Mexican fare. In this day and age of $3000 rents, it would be very difficult to incentivize the average person to choose a $20 entree over a $7 burrito from the million taquerias within a 1 mile radius that tastes great in its own right. If this were in... say, Palo Alto or something, this place would have line to get in!

Anyway, I'm a fan of this place, and hope they stick around!
author: Kazu O.

description: Just.. OK.  I found everything kinda bland actually.  We were one of three tables in total, and didn't receive the best servcie all things considered.  Just MEH.
author: Kelly C.

description:
This high end Mexican restaurant uses their Rotisserie Chicken in most of their dishes, which is a good way to make sure all the ingredients are super fresh and not left sitting around. For appetizers, try the Chicken Taquitos which are very crispy without being too oily. They go great with the fresh guacamole.

For entrée choices, while the Rotisserie Chicken is very good by itself, it's better to eat it in the various forms like the Chicken Enchiladas Verde, which taste surprisingly light and flavorful without being too salty. The easy drizzling of sour cream on top blends all the flavors together very nicely. 

Another excellent dish to order is the Chicken mole here. It has a rich smoky flavor that infuses with the sweet hints of dark chocolate in the sauce. 

If driving over to the Mission during the evenings, finding parking can be like winning the lottery.
author: Mark Y.

description:
I had a business dinner here tonight.  We had our meeting in the patio, which is covered and over looks Buddha, the Blessed Virgin Mary and a tons of birds in the garden.  Very nice.

there are heaters to help keep ya warm and it tonight we needed those puppies on.  

The wine list is okay.. Malbec, Tempranillo and whites Pinot Grigio, Sauvignon Blanc.

I had Enchiladas Verdes   Handmade corn tortillas dipped in green chile sauce. Filled with roast chicken, garnished with queso fresco, crema, onions and cilantro. Served with whole pintos and rice.  pretty damn good.

my partners had: 

Pollo Regalito
1/2 roast free-range chicken; choice of lime or Chile-garlic marinade, choice of sauteed greens or roasted potatoes.
Tinga De Pollo
Shredded free-range chicken in chipotle sauce, served with rice and avocado salsa.


I will go back maybe for lunch but it is a little pricey.
author: Princess P.

description: Probably the best margaritas we've ever had. Best part is that they weren't too sweet and had just enough kick! Go for the carafe (pitcher), perfect for a group of 4. Food was amazing also. We got the burrito and Tinga de Pollo and they were fantastic and great portion.
author: Maggie C.

description:
higher end mexican, all the food we have tried over our visits has been great.

the tacos may be the most impressive however, best in a mecca.  

not to mention probably the best deal in the area as well...
author: Paris T.

description: This might be my favorite spot in the city. Incredible space, awesome outdoor patio, amazing food. The veggie enchilada might be the best thing I've ever eaten in my life. Staff is incredibly friendly, def family owned. Just incredible.
author: Paul C.

description:
Super yummy - 8.5 out of 10.  Loved dinner, skip apps.  Drinks were great (marg) and salsa was super spicy!

The food was great....but wait staff is stretched thin.  Come for the food, not the service (which is only ok).
author: Nick R.

description:
Skip it. Getting a same day reservation on a Thursday night was really easy--that probably should have been my first clue that this was going to be a mediocre experience at best.

The service was fine--not particularly good, but not bad either--and the menu looked promising. The food, on the other hand, left A LOT to be desired. For appetizers, we ordered the taquitos and the Papas con Chorizo. The taquitos were perfectly fried and the chorizo was tasty. For my main course, I ordered the ribs, which were served with rice and beans. The rice was not your typical Mexican-style rice. It was white rice, sauteed with onions and garlic, and had an oily texture. The refried beans were extremely salty. The ribs were tough and they did NOT remove the silvery membrane on the bone side of the slab of ribs. What self-respecting restaurant leaves the membrane on the ribs?! Amateur move. Hubby ordered the cochinita pibil which looked delicious, but was extremely bland and desperately needed salt.

The price point is similar to Nopalito, but the execution of the food was sub-par. Considering the availability of low-price, quality Mexican food in the Mission as well as the smattering of higher-priced full-service Mexican restaurants in the city generally (think Nopalito, Padrecito, etc.), Regalito Rosticeria really needs to step up its game. Will not be coming back.
author: Jacki S.

description:
It had been awhile since I'd been here and really wanted to take my partner with me to sample some authentic quality Oaxacan food. The last time I was here was a few years ago, but I remember being very impressed with the freshness of the food and really liked that they use free-range meat. I had the house special roast chicken before, but wanted to experiment a bit. As it turns out, we were very happy with our selections, which our very sweet and enthusiastic wait person was very helpful with. 

The menu offered such interesting vegetarian options as well as meat dishes. We started with a botana; a vegetable empanada. The masa was delicate and the filling flavorful but not overwhelming. It was served with a little marinated red onion salad, which was the perfect compliment. We enjoyed some of the house sangria as well which was very flavorful and fruity without being too sweet. 

For entrees, we shared the tinga de polla and a chili relleno. The chili relleno was a pasilla chili stuffed with squash, herbs, onions and topped with melting cotija cheese. We loved the texture and thought the flavor was delicate and very special.

The tinga de pollo almost reminded me of Hawaiian kalua pork, with it's smokiness, but the avacado, lime and other flavors made it much more complex and very tasty. Our server informed us that they go out of their way to make it very authentic and use a unique recipe as well as very carefully prepare the ingredients. The house-made tortillas were scrumptious and we loved scooping up the chicken with them. 

For dessert, we had the best churros we've ever had in our lives! We were so full, we didn't think we'd finish them, but couldn't leave a delectable morsel behind! 

Overall, we thought the restaurant had nice atmosphere and great service! I think some of the folks that have reviewed this restaurant are looking for a Cancun-style taqueria, and this is oh-so-much-more special than that. Yes, you have to pay a bit more for this kind of quality, but the $ is totally worth the value. We can't wait to go back!
author: Lisa F.

description:
When you charge $17 for an entree of carnitas, you set a high precedent. We really wanted to like Regalito. The design is nice, the menu options sounded delightful, and we even got a recommendation from a customer who was leaving, urging us to try it. So we were more than disappointed when the food arrived. 

The portions aren't huge. The carnitas came served with a little bit of salsa, a few slices of avocado, some pinto beans, and some corn tortillas, but the overall meal was just bland. I think we would have been satisfied if the food was good--but it was just okay--not rich in flavor like we expected. 

To be fair, the service was good and the sangria was also very good. But those aren't good enough reasons to come back to a place that significantly overcharges for its food (especially in a neighborhood like the Mission where there are so many good Mexican places to choose from). Sadly, Regalito is nothing special.
author: Lisa N.

description:
Overpriced guacamole $11 
Guacamole had very little seasoning

The salad greens were not that fresh and the salad was not that great

Tacos are decent 
Need to chill on the pineapple

Service is amazing
author: Sanaz E.

description:
I see a number of negative reviews, but that definitely wasn't my experience!  I've enjoyed myself each time I've been there.

Regalito Rosticeria has been around for a few years, but it seems to fly under the radar.  I've been there 5 or 6 times, both to pick up roast chicken to carry out and to dine in.  Each time the food has been delicious and the service warm and friendly.  

I have enjoyed the roast chicken (which they seem to always have), the carnitas, the Cochinita Pibil, and the ribs.  All have been delicious.
author: Bruce S.

description:
We've gone here several times and they never really change their menu. There are always so few veggie options. In fact they modify the enchiladas...replacing the chicken with vegetables. But the vegetables are so skimpy...it's mostly 3 big hunks of cooked corn meal in green sauce for $17. Kind of crazy.

It's one of the few "gourmet" Mexican restaurants we've been to...so that's why I'm keeping it at 3 stars...but I want to check out others because this just can't be the best.
author: Leslie K.

description:
Guacamole served with store-bought tostada shells: $11.
Can soda: $3.75 - wow!
Green rice made with kale and spinach to cater to vegans: mi Abuela would cringe!
No seafood on the menu whatsoever.
Plastic Ikea-style chairs to sit at a beautiful, solid wood table is just not right.
According to our server, this restaurant has only been open for about 18 months, so I guess we will have to give them some time.
author: Dee M.

description: I wanted to post this review of regalito focusing primarily on the quality of the dishes and the traditional style that Eduardo and his kitchen staff follow. Growing up in SF I remember on going to Chavitas on 17th St. and los Jarritos at the corner of S. Van Ness Ave. As I remember it these were two of the "most authentic" Mexican restaurants in town and considering that I traveled to Mexico regularly when I was young I knew that these restaurants were not very good or very authentic. Regalito under Eduardo's management is in my opinion one of the most authentic Mexican restaurants in town. His touch is so good that even the beans taste amazing. The other dishes like the cochinita is simply superb and no other place in the city makes the cochinita the way that Eduardo cooks his. While some might say that the servings are small the truth is that outside of the US supersizing is not a thing, meaning that in my opinion the dishes are of more than adequate size. Some have also complaint about the burritos, well the point of this restaurant is for you to eat real dishes that are more authentic. I have tried almost all the dishes and my personal preference is the cochinita simply because I love the dish and know how very very hard it is to cook it, that said the enchiladas are amazing and the chicken is very good. I hope that they continue the good work.
author: A.M. E.

description:
Overall, a disappointment. I don't understand the positive reviews here. Regalito has little to offer. Let's go through the categories. 

Comfort: We were seated at the bar area on freezing cold metal chairs, and it was a cold night to begin with, so the chairs were literally sucking any warmth away from our butts. They were hard and uncomfortable. Looking around, people are crammed in little tables on unpadded chairs. I don't understand why restauranteurs miss this simple, but crucial point. Make your guests comfortable. Put comfortable chairs in your restaurant. It's not that difficult.

Ambiance: Very small and very loud. I don't recall any music, or anything to enhance the vibe.

Drinks: They have no liquor license, so forget about getting a margarita with actual tequila. That's a major bummer.

Food: The core food is decent here, but it is not as good as I expected it to be. The dishes are fairly simple with minimal creativity, and portions are smaller than the prices suggest. I prefer Mexico City-style flair. Color. Fruit. European influences. Regalito has none of that. The dishes, although solid, are somewhat boring.

The Chili Relleno, which is traditionally a stuffed pepper, wasn't even stuffed. The ingredients were lazily ladled on top of a charred pepper. Disappointing.

Cost: For what you get, and for the Mission, it's not a great value. $18-$25 for one entree.

Service: The kitchen is literally right in front of you and it is clear from the workload of the cooks that they were totally overwhelmed. There are only two cooks working the entire restaurant, and they were busting their asses. I felt so sorry for them, I wanted to go back there and help them. This is why it took quite some time to get our food. We waited and waited.

Made the mistake of ordering dessert. Again, waiting and waiting. Cooks overwhelmed.

Frustrated, I told the server and he assured me that they were frying the churros. I told him he was full of it, because I was watching them the whole time. Sure enough he asked, and they hadn't even started. Thankfully he took it off our bill, we paid and left. Never to return.
author: Brian C.

description:
The BEST guacamole in SF !!  
But what's up with the STUPID non-biodegradable napkins?  I'll go back when paper napkins that can be composted go back on the tables.
author: J J.

description:
I used the Groupon. What a deal!

Obviously, this place is going to charge more than your regular mexican joint in the Mission. This place has ambiance and waiter service, and they're gonna charge you for them.

We ordered:
- Papas con chorizos: the chorizos is yummy with oily goodness
- Pollo regalito: tender juicy roasted chicken. I like the collard greens that comes with it too
- Enchiladas rojas: I don't really like enchiladas in the first place, so this one is ok. My boyfriend really likes it tho.
- Churros: can't go wrong with churros!
- Flan: way too eggy. I think this is the only failed dish.

Service is outstanding. The owner always ask how we're doing, our water is always filled promptly, he also gave us the habanero salsa which is really good and spicy. Their tortilla is also made fresh. We sat at the bar so we watched the entire process, it's pretty cool.

You definitely need a reservation, otherwise you can just sit at the bar. Which is ok too, since you can watch the lady making tortilla in front of you.

We had a great time. Thank you!
author: Novalina N.

description:
OH MY GOD!  Moved up here from SoCal 8 years ago and have been bitching about the Mexican food here in SF ever since.  Had always had this place on my radar but for some reason had never made it here - ease of rezzies totally had something to do with it. 

Well the wait was too long at some place on Valencia tonight so stumbled in as a backup - ok well we have to eat - and lo and behold - the purity of the flavors brought me right back to the essence of what I have been missing in the Mexican food in El Norte. 

Can't believe it has taken me so long but I think I've finally found my solid go-to Mexican place in SF!
author: Lee Y.

description: Came here for dinner with a group of local friends on a Thursday nite, with someone from the Jersey shore. We felt very much at home the food & service was amazing. We had the chicken mo'le, carnitas, chicharron & taquitos de papas with hand made warm tortillas that were to die for. Great service, great atmosphere...our first time here but definitely not our last!
author: Jonathan M.

description:
The staff was super friendly, moving us to a warmer seating area when they saw we were cold. Offering to charge my phone behind the bar, keeping us updated about food times. 
The food was amazing we go the fish tacos and stuffed pepper !! I was so full but couldn't stop eating. Highly recommend this place !!!
author: Leslie S.

description:
San Francisco is known for having some of the best restaurants around; this place is guilty of adding to that reputation!  

Atmosphere 5 stars:

Despite the small place, my party and I were seated in our own cozy corner looking out of the window.  The lights, decor, and our lone candle created an intimate effect that made me feel like we were in our own little place, despite being in a bustling restaurant.

Customer service *6 stars:
 
We were seated immediately and our waiter never lingered from his attentiveness.  He would check up on us, being mindful of our privacy and space.  And, when one of us left a scarf at the table, even though we were blocks away on our way home, the waiter came running after us to return it.  That alone garners an *EXTRA STAR!

Cuisine 5+ Stars:

Words cannot articulate the mouth watering ecstasy that is inspired by their divine menu!  Forget the oil dripping, calorie hoarding that most often accompanies Mexican food.  This menu is filled with organic meats and produce, fresh cheese, and chips that are crispy, minus all the grease!  You leave here with your belly full, without any guilt of committing a fatty food crime!  

**A far leap from your roadside taqueria, this place will prove to you that Mexican food made right can be tasty without compromising healthy!  Better yet, the service is just well above par!  Coming back again, and highly recommending this place is a no brainer!**
author: Carmen M.

description:
We wandered in to Regalito after leaving another restaurant - ready for round 2.

There was absolutely no wait which could have been a sign that we were in for a regretful meal.... this was definitely not the case.

We sat in the back "room" which is a tented space with some pretty strong heat lamps.  I am a wimp with cold and I was still very comfortable - this could have been partly due the the bottle of wine they let us bring in.  

The service was great.  Everyone there was friendly and helpful!

We didn't have a full meal, just had some table snacks to share:
-Guacamole - VERY delicious but a little pricey for the amount they gave us
-Chips served with the guac - large tostada-style, round crisps that we broke apart pre-dip, replenished when we went through the 1st plate
-Pork/carne tacos - delicious
-Veggie taco - sauteed zucchini, not bad but not my favorite

We will definitely be back to try more of the dinner entrees next time!
author: Whit C.

description:
Excellent experience. We had a very large group for brunch, for which they gave us the entire back patio. The ambiance was amazing, love the space.

The servers were extremely positive and helpful. Our mimosas truly were bottomless: they kept them full for 2 hours! The guacamole was very fresh and delicious. Tacos were just spicy enough and very savory. They even tolerated our group controlling the music our area for a while!

All in all loved the place, highly recommend for large group brunch parties.
author: jacob m.

description:
El Regalito--"the little gift" is a BIG gift to San Francisco!  
If you're fond of gourmet Mexican cooking, this place fits the bill perfectly.  The cochinita pibil is the best we have ever tasted.  Eduardo, the manager, says it's his grandmother's recipe.  She was a chef in Mexico and taught him well.  The pork is marinated overnight in orange juice, garlic, achiote and other spices and wrapped in banana leaves.  The result is an amazing, tender, juicy, flavorful treat.  We also sampled the beef tamales in a wonderful tomatillo sauce and the chicken in Oaxacan mole and they were also wonderful.  The agua de tamarindo tastes just like the tamarind fruit off the trees that grow south of the border.  The service was thoughtful and prompt. We all left in a happy glow.
author: George L.

description: Sooo good. Margaritas are deadly, staff is attentive, and have never had a bad meal. Seriously order every appetizer (but don't miss the chicharonnes​, and papas chorizo). Great veggie options too.
author: Kay M.

description:
Our Mission (in the Mission) for dinner:
- great food
- good set up for a catch up with friends
- cozy ambiance
- centrally located

The stars were on our side tonight because Regalito met those criteria, and we were able to walk in and get a table during the prime dinner hour. Thank goodness for holiday weekends when most locals are away.

My friend mentioned they are known for their handmade tortillas and mole. I tried the tortillas and they were delicious. Tonight the mole came with the one-remaining special lamb dish, which I decided to skip. Instead I ordered the Enchiladas Rojas ~ "Handmade corn tortillas dipped in red sauce of New Mexico and Guajillo chilies; garnished with onino and queso fresco; with rice and whole pintos." I really enjoyed this. I had a bite of my friend's Enchiladas Verdes, which was also wonderful.

Also tried the Elote ~ "grilled corn on the cob, cotija cheese, house-made mayonnaise, lime, and chile powder." Decadent and delicious. Note to Self: Don't order this on a date (unless I want to make it an awkward one), it's pretty messy.

For dessert, we had the Capirotada ~ "Warm bread pudding with apples, raisins, nuts & Oaxacan Queso; Mexican vanilla gelato." Fantastic! My friend, Jeanine S. described it like a 'bready apple pie' ~ heavenly. We all enjoyed our food.

Our server also brought a spicy avocado cream sauce with cilantro. I loved this.

The ambiance is warm and modern. I love their colorful artwork. 

The service is charming. Can't wait to go back.
author: Cathy K.

description:
The highlight was the taquito appetizer - do not miss them!  (We got to sit at the counter and watch the gal make them- from pulling and chopping the chicken to rolling them) - quite laborious!

The entrees were okay - Chicken mole & the pork.

I did enjoy the churro and hot chocolate as well.

So in ranking order 
1) Appetizers - YUMMY
2) Dessert - Hell yeah!
3) Entree - Meh
4) Service - Meh....
author: Amy W.

description: Had a great Mole there.  Nice place with "outside" seating as well.  Sangria was pretty good too :)
author: Kanoa B.

description: The food was not tasty ... There are better places to eat , plus this place was wayyyy to expensive.... 17 for 3 enchiladas.... Crazy.... Will never go there again!!!!
author: cindy a.

description: Best. Guacamole. Ever.  And the Agave Margaritas are perfect.  Don't be foolish, give this place a shot!  Hopefully, you're lucky to have Francisco as your waiter...very friendly & attentive!
author: Chrissy M.

description: Dessert tastes like was refrigerated for a few days. The bread pudding tasted like was microwaved and was tough.
author: Heather M.

description: Atmosphere is cute, liked that they have a Buddha and Virgin Mary statue. Now as far as the food goes its a bit overpriced for the serving and real bland and if u want beans and rice its extra oh and the sangria was like fruit punch. I would not come here again. Sorry! The staff was nice i must say.
author: Erika H.

description:
This would be my first ever Yelp post!  Went to Regalito Rosticeria this morning.  I bought the Huevos Americanos for 13 dollars.  I assumed that it would be a more filling dish, and literally laughed out loud when I was presented my plate. 
The dish came with two eggs and potatoes and bacon. The two eggs were pretty standard and there was the equivalent of maybe 2 slices of bacon sliced in half twice to create a sad illusion of caloric substance.  The serving of potatoes is what really made me laugh.  I kid you not, there were 5 pieces of potatoes roughly fingertip size. I ate them in one bite to make a point. 

My entire meal was gone in probably 45 seconds and I immediately went from the restaurant to a taqueria for some actual food.  I now understand why my group of 15 were the only ones in the restaurant during brunch hour on a sunday morning.  No one wants to pay $15 for a tiny portion of mediocre mexican food (especially not in the Mission where options abound).  Regalito literally means "little gift" so I guess they are referring to their portion sizes.
author: Jake S.

description:
I was really excited to try this place because I was under the impression that the chicken would be particularly good.

Unfortunately, it was very lackluster. We tried the chicken taquitos, the chicken enchiladas, and the pollo regalito. We finished with the house made churros and hot chocolate.

These were all lacking in flavor to the point where we did not bother bringing our leftovers home. It just seemed like they don't season their food very much. And while I'm aware that these things happen (we are eating animals, after all), there were various pieces of bones in my enchiladas.

I thought dessert would end on a high note, but sadly the hot chocolate was brought to us cold. And it wasn't a particularly busy night.

As far as service, it also left something to be desired. Even though I made a reservation, our server tried to seat us at the bar. What is the point in making a reservation if they're just going to try to squeeze you at the bar? There was obviously a table for two that was available, which we took. Additionally, getting your water glass refilled didn't seem to be high on their priority list. I ordered a mexican coke, but my boyfriend ended up having to snag my glass because there wasn't anyone to refill his.

This place is not on the cheap side, and for these kind of basic issues it was simply not worth it.
author: Katie S.

description:
I'm from Southern California and was taken here by my boyfriend from New York.... so The ambiance was great and the service was excellent... very friendly and efficient. 

the food was bland. the guacamole was fresh but had no cilantro, no onion, and no lime. not to mention they were served with packaged tostadas. not even fresh tortilla chips 

the rice and beans reminded me of something I've had years ago at el pollo loco. the enchiladas were good. fresh roasted chicken and the tortillas were "homemade" but not in house 

all in all it seams to be overpriced and catered to the white folk.
author: Gina G.

description:
I was envious about my friends' cochinita pibil until I tasted the ribs I ordered: I was transported. 
This is seriously fine cooking: thank you!
author: Rishad P.

description:
Does nobody ever order the Cauliflower Ceviche?  

Our waiter's face expressed shock when J and I kicked off our meal by ordering the cauliflower ceviche appetizer.  Though we'd already ordered it, he seemed to be warning us off it:  "Some people think it needs more salt" he reported.  Often, I'd heed this warning, but I was curious.  

Cauliflower, tomatoes, onions, and jalapenos bathed in a lime juice, topped with fresh avocado slices, and served with chips and a side of habanero salsa.  It was good; a cross between pico de gallo and ceviche (minus any seafood), and no extra salt needed. 

We shared a fine bottle of red ($36 - $40) though I think the sangria would have paired better with the food.  

Knowing that RR turns into "Pigalito", with an all pig menu once weekly, J opted for the pork special which our waiter reported had been roasting all day, along with pineapple and other goodness.  Served with beans and tortillas, the pork was definitely the blue ribbon award winner:  Delectably tasty, it reminded us of a dish someone would prepare for their best friend in their Guatemalan kitchen.  They know their pork here.  

I was wavering between two meatless entrees and took the waiter's recommendation of the Chile Relleno ($16), which was mild in flavor and unremarkable and made me wish I'd gotten a chicken or pork dish instead.  

There's a million other - and better and cheaper - places to choose from in the Mission but RR is a nice place.  They do pork well and the long bar looked like a comfortable place to enjoy a meal as a single diner.
author: Tracey A.

description: We had a lovely meal here!  The white bean and asparagus salad lacked distinctive flavor, but our entrees were stellar!  We loved the tinga de pollo (shredded ckicken) dish, and the poc chuc (pork tenderloin) was quite flavorful as well.  The churros we had for dessert were scrumptious!  Oh, the white sangria was refreshing and tasty!  The service was also attentive yet unobstrusive.  Thanks for a great meal, Regalito!
author: Barnali D.

description:
Great little find in the Mission District

My girlfriends and I had a great dinner and lots of fun laughter. We enjoyed the Taquitos de Polloo de Papas y Queso, Enchiladas Verdes, Pollo Regalito, and to top it off Churros y Chocolate. During dinner we enjoyed Agave Wine Margaritas.

Highly recommend this little gem.
author: Deanna I.

description:
I don't always take pictures of my food.  I used to never.  Yelp has helped draw something from the deep recesses of my soul.  Gee.  Thanks.

Had I been more in the game last night I'd have made a photograph of the fellow cutting up pig parts with the skilsaw.  I heard him muttering, no ... vegetarian ... entrees ... ever.

Not much fish either.

But the pork and the chicken deeshes, loveys, they were so good.

Warm nopales ensalada, green enchiladas con crema y queso fresco.  Michaelito had carnitas.  I had a bite.  They were good.  The flavors reminded me of Dona Tomas as they hailed from a similar origin.  The setting is very different.  Small, maybe ten tables.  Counter seating for the rest of us (and after the skilsaw ballet last night I don't know if I'd want to be seated anywhere else).

Until I ran the beggar gauntlet for the second time I felt as I often feel about the Mission (why am I not residing here).  Happily, the welcoming committee saw it better to turn me to the train.  To head back to Temescal where the asks per stride of sidewalk are maybe only one to a hundred.

Thanks, Regalito, for sending me home with a happy belly.
author: Markus N.

description: We ate at Regalito because we couldn't get into Tacolicious.....But, it was amazing!  I am a big fan of roasted chicken and theirs is superb!!!  And the Kale Salad is also amazing!!!  I can't wait to go back and get some other things!!
author: Ann S.

description: Quaint & good! Their chicken &  mole was so tender and delicious. Friendly service. Would return. :)
author: Lola Z.

description:
Delicious, authentic, warm, and unique.  I don't typically love most Mexican restaurants from the start, so I was surprised to have such a great experience immediately.  

I dined here for brunch and liked the unique options on the menu.  Salsa was tasty and gradually spicy (not bland or too hot from the start). I enjoyed their tortilla soup, and eggs with chorizo.  You must try the tres leches for dessert.  Looking forward to the next time...
author: Jen V.

description: Love love the margaritas !   Next you have to get the chicken!   Delicious!   A little pricey but who cares!   The Mission is pricey!   Sit outide and enjoy the parade of  people walking down the street!  have seen Mark Zuckerberg!  And Madonna!   How cool is that!
author: Rob P.

description:
Always friendly. Always good. Always fun on the back patio. 

I love this place every since it opened. This is not the place for those that only flock to trendy places because it's for people who like good food with friendly service and modern Mexican food. I love the fresh guacamole, chile verde, roasted chicken and brunches on the patio!
author: Flynt I.

description:
Sometimes you just need to give something a few years to grow into itself or to be mature enough to have a taste for it. 
Take:
.fishy-fish you wouldn't eat growing up
.the bottle of Napa cab that needed cellaring 
.slightly geeky guy you sat next to in calc class, going through the awkward years
.a meal at Regalito a few summers back, not particularly memorable

Fast Forward:
.you relish the opportunity to seek out new seafood joints and oyster bars
.the cab is solid, but not worth the wait.
.intelligence is sexy and who knew he'd look like that years later?
.a meal at Regaltio this summer:
     vibrant and fresh interior with a bustling patio. Looks, at first glance, can be deceiving. A jam packed interior seems promising, a non-stop avocado-slinging, spring onion-grilling, tostada-frying, bandana-wearing knife-wielder behind the counter played the part well. He made it look good. Too good. The guacamole was crazy fresh, but the flavor was beyond mild. Not worth the ten bucks.

I eyed my plate of rotisserie chicken sit for too long before making its way to table, not as hot as it should have been and less-than-tender. Enchiladas Verdes (chicken) were a hit. Rice and beans left much to be desired. The hot sauce/salsa (by request) had enough flavor to make up for the entire meal. But sometimes it's just too late.

I sipped off my friend's glasses of sangria, but could have swung for a glass of the fruity stuff myself. The only saving grace.

She looks better, but as adults, we know that isn't enough. She won't be remembered long after I finish my leftovers.
author: Alissa A.

description: I've been going to Regalito for 8 yrs. It's my go-to for authentic Mexican food. It's the closest thing to eating my mom's Mexican food. These guys have done a great job with the decor and changing up the menu with the best ingredients. If you want American Mexican food (ie, Chevy's or Tacolicious), you won't get your margaritas and endless chips and salad here. Instead you'll get real Mexican food.
author: Bobby James G.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised.  Overall the food was quite good, and the service was friendly and responsive without being intrusive.  We shared the taquitos appetizer which was quite tasty.  I had the chicken mole enchiladas for an entree and they were superb and quite filling (I was unable to finish it).  The mole sauce was spicy, sweet, nutty, chocolate-y... everything a good mole sauce should be.  My date got the carnitas plate and wiped it clean.  We shared the churros and chocolate for dessert.

The one down side was the lack of a full liquor license.  Mexican food just begs to be accompanied by a great margarita or a nice smooth tequila straight up, and while the agave wine margarita was OK, it really didn't hit the spot.  I hope they get their full liquor license - it would increase greatly the chance of my returning.  Otherwise, I think I'd stick to Regalito for lunch and hit up another good Mission Mexican place for the tequila with food.
author: Kathryn E.

description: Carnitas... Plain and simple, perfectly cooked with some of the tastiest  beans and corn tortillas outside of Mexico . The service was exceptional. I'll go back very soon!
author: Judy S.

description:
Every time I've eaten at regalito has been wonderful. The food, service, and ambiance is great. 

We always order the guacamole, which is so fresh and delicious. Add a little of the habanero salsa to give it a nice kick. 

The enchiladas verdes (chicken) and rojas (cactus) are excellent and very filling. Their homemade corn tortillas are the best I've had. I could eat them every day :)

The cochinita pibil is very tender with wonderful flavors. 

For dessert, the churros and chocolate are a great way to end dinner (leaving you stuffed!)
author: Giana M.

description:
I've had all sorts of fancy-schmancy Mexican inspired food.  And I like it a lot.  But for a change I decided to go after something more home-style.  And Regalito fits the bill to a tee.  You get a heartfelt welcome when you enter.  The place is nice and clean.  And the food is just plain great and it comes at a great price.

Sopa De Tortillas was a deeply satisfying chicken soup loaded with tortilla strips, queso fresco, avocado and cilantro.  Good stuff.

A salad of grilled cactus, onion, avocado, and tomato was ample and fresh.  Enough said.

Carnitas was pork shoulder cooked in pork fat, served with avocado, salsa fresca, and whole pintos.  The serving was immense, the meat tender to the fork, and the beans were the perfect complement to the protein.

I left stuffed and happy.
author: David D.
