Leaving the restaurant full, but not completely satisfied, the consensus was that although some dishes were tasty, filling, and moderately priced, there was not whole lot that would make me choose going to Regalito over Nopalito. The creativity and breadth of the Nopalito menu makes it tough for any challengers to compete in this ever growing genre of what I like to call "Gentrified Mexican".
author: Alex O.

description:
I walked out of this place with a food high. This place is essentially authentic gourmet Mexican food. I'd say along the same lines of nopalito... but maybe just a little better. My friend and I really like spicy food, so it was just what we wanted. If you are sensitive to spice you might want to read the menu carefully.

We got delicious guacamole, empanadas, the rotisserie chicken dish and ended with flan.

Guac was good- fresh, made to order. Empanadas were some of the best I've had in the city, I have a small obsession with empanadas and my friend really enjoyed the chicken- very spicy she said.

The flan was ehh... tasted a little burnt, it was good in the general world of flan but I have had much better.

Service was great, they were busy but seemed to work as a team. The restaurant is pretty small, word on the street is they are in the process of getting permits to open up a back patio. The whole vibe of the restaurant was great- friendly & relaxed- mixed crowd, a convergence of all types of neighborhood folks. 

Def plan ahead and make a reservation.

Will come back again!
author: Veronica T.

description:
My sister had her wedding dinner reception here on 1/18/14 with 45 guests. Originally I have eaten hear before with my mom through a good deal I found on Groupon. I suggested the place to my sister and her fiancé, bought them a Groupon, they loved the food and what clearly sold them was their little mini zen like garden in the back where you see the Virgin Guadalupe and a Buddah. This was perfect because they both have traveled together to Mexico and China. Eduardo [Restaurant Manager and Main Host] made it so easy for me to bring any decoration to best showcase the wedding reception. What made it even more special was that my sister and her fiancé had requested a very simple one layer tres leches wedding cake; Eduardo had two made, one to serve at the dinner and the other for the wedding couple to take home.
Definitely a fun night to remember for everyone.

If you are looking for a clean, colorful, and fun ambiance then this is the place to bring friends or a date to dine. The sound is pleasant enough to hold a conversation. The main host, Eduardo, is very attentive and professional to all guests that come in, in addition, also makes great recommendations on what to try. If you ever hear of their Wine Pairing event it's definitely a must go. The owner, Thomas, and the kitchen staff is wonderful and on point when it comes to food prepping, cooking, and display as they helped in my sister's wedding reception dinner. You can not go wrong with any item on their menu; it's all delicious and you can really feel that everyone there enjoys what they do. Bravo!
author: Danielle L.

description:
Thoroughly enjoyed this, my first meal at the restaurant.  Having read the menu my partner and I are already planning a return trip to try more of the items-- which is remarkable given my partner typically doesn't even care for Mexican.  But then,  this is not your typical taqueria, and  the menu and atmosphere are definitely a little upscale.  Don't worry, not  'too'. 

Grilled cactus, a great starter that's light, bright and refreshing; carne asada with mushrooms, grilled to perfection; chicken with thick Mole sauce, also very well executed. Add the Sangria course. . . Good times!
author: Mark N.

description:
Other reviews are causing me to second guess my taste buds.  Maybe I was hungry, maybe the other folks had an off night.  I love this place!  I'm a bit of a extremist when it comes to food/restaurants so I either love or hate a place and if it's in between I don't fee compelled to yelp about it.

About the food, I had the mole chicken and it was just right.  Spicy, flavorful, and juicy.  We had dinner at around 5:30, so the chicken was fresh off the rotisserie.  We also had a seat at the counter next to the spot where the waiters pick up the dishes(I'm sure there's a technical term for it) which in my opinion is the best seat in the house.  We had the chance to talk to the owner about every dish we saw.  The pork dishes made me want to bend my no pork rule.  The chicken verde enchiladas are a local favorite and I plan to try them the next time.  The agua de tamarindo is refreshing and a must.
author: Diana M.

description: I've been here twice now and both times have been great! We come in early for brunch and there is never a wait and seating near their beautiful back patio has always been available for us. Service is fabulous and the food is even better! The huevos rancheros are to die for!
author: Lexi M.

description:
Buying indiscriminately means it's time for Shopaholics Anonymous. I'd never even heard of Regalito Rosticeria but clicked on the "Buy Now" hot button on Groupon.com when they featured $15 for $35 worth of food here. Only after the purchase was made did I bother to read the lukewarm reviews about RR, but to my surprise (& relief), their dishes were not bad at all. 

* [guacamole & tostadas]: generous portion with discernible chunks of avocado, tomato, & onion. loved that they served fresh-out-of-the-fryer tostadas instead of chips. the guac could have used a bit more "kick" but a spoonful of red salsa gave it lots of spice. 
* [elote]: roasted corn on the cob w/ mayo, chile powder, lime & cojita cheese. loved it! my favorite way to eat roasted corn!
* [pollo regalito]: with a lime marinade & potatoes. the 1/2 chicken was nicely prepared & tender enough. i don't usually eat chicken skin, but I tried a few bites & the lime flavor was potent. potatoes were flavorless.
* [cochinita pibil]: achiote marinated pork. i didn't try it the bf liked it very much. 
Total: $15 for Groupon coupon & $16 (including tax & tip) for our meal after discount.

RR is a clean, modern, intimate space; you can see & hear your food being prepared in the open kitchen. Definitely a more upscale Mexican dining experience compared to the taquerias in the area (no burritos here), which is reflected in the prices. Our waitress was lovely & while I really enjoyed the guac & the roasted corn, it isn't enough to make me rush back (especially without a Groupon.)

FYI: RR is located right across the street from Luna Park (which I've been to, so I don't know why I've never noticed this greyish corner building before...I need to be a little more attentive, jeez!)
author: Fancypants X.

description: We've been foodie fans of Regalito since the opened.  You can't go wrong with just about anything on the menu.  Great guacamole with home made tortillas.  Home made tortillas are so good that you almost don't need anything on them.  Love their rotisserie chicken, chili Colorado and every pork dish on the menu.  For desert try the tres leche cake as it's outstanding.  Love this place so much that I try to eat here a couple times a month.  Go and enjoy a great meal.
author: David G.

description:
Came here on the groupon. One appetizer, two entrees and one dessert. 

I had been here before but I do not remember and parking in the mission is always so hard to find. 

We started with the Taquitos and then I had Mole and my partner had the enchiladas verde.

So the Mole I am not a fan of here, but I can in no way mark them down for that. There probably are millions of ways to make Mole. Every abuela probably has their own recipe handed down thru generations and this Mole happened to be different. I prefer a darker mole, with more heat. This was a little sweet for me, but in no way reflects on the quality of their Mole as I am sure some people would probably like it. The portions are good and the service was great. 

We had the rice pudding for dessert but I think we should have maybe got the flan.  We will be back again .
author: Michael T.

description:
Are you kidding me? This place combines the worst of the restaurant dining experience all in one restaurant:

-Slow service? Check. 
And when I mean slow. I mean slooooooooooooow. We ordered 1 chicken enchilada and one veggie enchilada. Between ordering and getting the food it took 1 HOUR and 30 MINUTES. And there was something like 10 other people the in the restaurant. Shameful.

-Incompetent service? Check.
45 minutes in, we asked where our food was. The waitress rudely said, "just on its way". Um, 45 minutes later, no not really. I also asked for a COKE with no ice. She brought a coke with ice. I mean, do you guys know how to follow directions? Again, there are only like 10 other people in the restaurant so its not like I was asking for too much.

-Gross food. Double-check!
Seriously, I can take some abuse (long wait, poor service) if the food over-compensates. Aside from decent guacamole, this place fails miserably. The enchiladas were - and I am not exaggerating - disgusting. The sauce on it was completely bland. The veggie enchiladas had no veggies! Worst of all, both enchiladas had no cheese (save for some sprinkles of cotija cheese on top of it). How can any enchiladas worth its name no have cheese? This is a Mexican restaurant, right? 

I love Mexican food. I don't know how this place survives in any city given how bad the food was, much less the Mission District in San Francisco where there some amazing places to eat Mexican food.

You couldn't pay me to eat here again.
author: Rick P.

description:
Don't understand the poor reviews on here. I can only guess it's a fundamental misunderstanding of what Mexico is really like. 

No, it's not taco truck food, so yes you're paying for the fresh ingredients and masterful preparation. It's is not Baja style, either, so maybe that's why the fish tacos were disappointing to some other yelpers? I like fish tacos, but I wouldn't order them in a place like this. 

We walked in at 8:30 on a Thursday night without a reservation, sat outdoors, and thoroughly enjoyed our meal. 

Service was polite and authentic (slow like real Mexican food is slow). We had the red sangria, which was wonderful (possibly the best sangria I've ever had in a restaurant). Both of our entrees were perfect (trucha and the tinga de pollo). Everything was moist, flavorful, and nicely balanced. I was even impressed by the green beans. 

The tortillas were the real deal, what you'd expect in the Mission where it's easy to get good tortillas. 

Highly recommended, but be prepared to wait for your food! Get a drink and chill out, amigos.
author: Sam Z.

description: Food is great! We happened to go on a day where they were short on wait staffand the place was hopping. Needless to say, service was slow, but we were understanding. We will definitely give them another try! The groupon deal was awesome too!
author: Paul Q.

description:
Cute, airy space.  

Super fresh-tasting yet comfort-foody filling.  Menu reads somewhat 'normal', but the preparation is unique and interesting.  Quesadillas are more like empanadas, enchiladas have no cheese inside unless you request it, etc....   It would be nice if the menu were more detailed to explain those differences and so you're not surprised, but it's no biggie because it's all delicious and different.  (btw, no burritos, amigos.)

Just got their liquor license yesterday = beer, wine and sangria are a comin...

ps They use as much local, organic as possible.  Nice one.
author: Melanie C.

description:
This place is one of the coolest Mexican food experiences I've ever had. Of course we've all had plenty of experience with greasy tacos and burritos, but this place is grown-up Mexican food. Farm to table kind of thing, prepared by actual chefs. There are no burritos (which is a good thing). Instead they have actual dishes of interesting food. I knew I was going to like this place when we ordered guacamole and we got a huge bowl of it. A restaurant that is generous with the valuable ingredients (avocado) is always a winner in my book.

In terms of drinks, I recommend their margarita of agave wine (I think that's what it's made out of). It's really cool since it's not made of actual tequila in the conventional sense.

I've been here once for a regular dinner, and once for their Tuesday Pigalito, where they roast an entire pig. Both times were excellent, and I plan to be back!..and for dessert be sure to check out the Capirotada!
author: Eric R.

description:
Overally, I was disappointed with my meal here.  I suppose the signs were there: while many of the other Mission restaurants were booked with long waits, our small party was seated within a few minutes.

I began my meal with a cup of the tortilla soup.  It was completely watered down, without any spice or flavor.  It basically seemed like small chunks of avocado and soggy tortilla floating in salt water.  I would NOT recommend the tortilla soup.

Our party shared the guacamole and tostada (large chips) dish.  The guac was very good, and really, the best part of the meal.

For my main dish I had the enchiladas rojas (with roasted chicken).  It was a decent serving size, but generally, it was quite bland.  It was all just a little underwhelming.

Service was super slow.  It took a really long time for our food to come out and the table next to ours requested the check as soon as the main dish came out to avoid any further delays.

Given that the best part of the meal was the guacamole, I wouldn't go back.
author: Marcin M.

description:
After reading the reviews, I was hoping for more pork, but I guess that is only during their Tuesday special Pigalito pig roast.

As such, I ordered the only pork entree on the menu, and was slightly underwhelmed. Everything else was chicken, good for you chicken lovers, but not for me.

We ordered a carafe of sangria for two of us, and while it was tasty, it certainly was hard to finish with all the food we ordered.

The guacamole was fantastic. It was very fresh with good onion flavor. There was not a lot of extra in it, which is just how I like it. Simple and straightforward.

For dessert I had the churros y chocolate. These were fabulous. They really rounded out my night, and my belly.

This place really is a little hole in the wall trying to be fancy. The service was good, but I think it is a little overpriced. It is hard for me to judge though, because my date paid.

I don't think I would come back for dinner, but I would come for guacamole and I would come for churros.
author: Caitlin H.

description:
Not a ton to add to the reviews in place - that is, the guac is fab (like the tostadas vs. chips approach), and the chicken plates to DIE for: my pollo tinga (pulled chicken over chipotle sauce) melted in my mouth; my bf's half-chicken in chile garlic sauce was hearty and satisfying; and my other friend's pollo con mole negro was insanely large and gratifying.

The service was over-the-top friendly, helpful and responsive. The atmosphere is intimate and final bonus is it is 3 blocks from where I live. Perhaps slightly over priced (avg plate price is $16 and they sizes are not huge) and the fact that they don't have margs is a MAJOR bummer, bu the food and service were so great that def want to come back - the pulled pork shoulder and carnitas are calling!
author: Diane B.

description: Service was great and the food was even better..Went on a Sunday for lunch and our group had the enchiladas, the cochinito and the mole. All great.and every bit authentic. Tortillas were out of this world.
author: Pedro P.

description:
I walked into this place one night since El Bueno Sabor had a line out the door. I looked inside and the spot seemed cool enough so we chanced it. We were seated at the counter and thats when I noticed that the cook was frying the enchiladas. It was at that point that I decided I will RIDE OR DIE FOR REGALITOS, and I hadn't even tasted the food yet.

See this is the deal, my mother fried her enchiladas, none of this bullshit baked mountain of cheese garbage sitting in some shitty sauce that every other mexican spot tries to pass as enchiladas. Now regalito's fries the tortillas in the sauce while my mother dipped the tortilla in sauce and then fried in oil, just a little difference but the point is that once I saw that I knew these dudes were for real.  It was the first time I have ever seen anyone outside of my own family prep their enchiladas like this.

I copped the enchiladas rojas (you can get the rojas with chicken if you ask too) of course and man they did it proper, just topped it with shredded lettuce, onion, crema and queso fresco. If the onions and lettuce had been soaked in lime juice I would have thought my grandmother worked there. I fucking murdered that plate. My girlfriend got the chile relleno and said it was the best she's ever had.   

I've gone back for brunch a few times, both the chilaquiles and the chorizo get a fuck yeah from me. Oh man another thing  regalitos does hella proper are the quesadillas. Fried corn tortillas with queso inside, goddamn I must be related to the chef because no one fucks with that shit! Dude really needs to serve these with eggs and refried beans cause thats what I ate almost every saturday morning when I was a young boy. But yeah Regalitos has official fucking blown my spot with the realness.
author: Sergio O.

description:
After looking at their menu, I was very excited to try Regalito.  We were supposed to come here last week, but ended up going to Limon Rotisserie instead (which was awesome).  

We ended up meeting up with some friends at Regalito for some sunday night dinner. 

I ordered the chicken with the lime marinade.  The chicken was dry, the skin wasn't crispy or particularly flavorful.  As their 'signature' dish (at least according to our waiter), I was spectacularly underwhelmed.  Actually, I would have preferred just having a $6 Safeway chicken.  My wife had the fish tacos and was similarly underwhelmed.

The Tortilla soup was very chicken-soup esque and fairly heavy/greasy for a place that's supposed to be healthy/fresh.

For $10/person more than Limon Rotisserie, I should have left with a much better taste in my mouth.

Final word: Perfect if you live in the Marina and want to 'check out the mission.'
author: Bob R.

description:
Overall, I'm not impressed at all with the restaurant.  The service was slow and inattentive.  Food was overpriced and just OK.

I would have been happier eating at the taqueria on the opposite corner.  Looked to be more authentic and filled with more customers.
author: Kim C.

description:
My boyfriend and I wandered in here after getting some new locks for our bikes.  We've been meaning to try Regalito for quite some time, but tend to default to our usual locations.  A few months ago, a guest gave us a Groupon as a gift for our hospitality, which gave us just the motivation we needed.  It was a Sunday afternoon and there was some other street festival going on, as there often is.  We were seated at the counter right away, and I actually love sitting that close to the chefs to watch the action.

Our service was friendly, prompt, and gave us some great suggestions.  Between the two of us, we ordered guacamole con tostadas, taquitos de papas y queso, chilaquiles, an agave wine margarita, and limonada.  Our food was delicious and came out with great timing so we had room for everything on the counter.  In my excitement to order, I totally forgot that my boyfriend does not like sour cream.  We were sharing our food, but decided that it was okay.  They accidentally brought us chicken taquitos instead of the potatoes, so they took that back immediately and rushed us the correct order.  Lucky for us, we were able to get the sour cream change made this time around with no hassles.
author: Melissa M.

description:
All the cool kids live in the mish. I live in the 'stro, just a short walk away because I am cool but I also like musicals. I am always looking for fun places to meet up with my mission pals...Spork, Monk's Kettle, Luna Park, tartine, delfina, little star...thought we'd give this place a try.

Food was a solid 4 stars but the service was a bit abismal (i.e. it was like pulling teeth just to get any service at all) and we got charged for completely random things on our bill (like 8 carafe's of sangria, which even me on my booziest day would not choose to consume). That took it down a star. Ultimately I think there are better places to go.
author: Nikki M.

description:
Welcome to the home of major service failures!  Three strikes in one visit = you're out!  

First inning:  How many times does some one have to ask a server if this dish or that dish or the other dish can be brought with the cheese on the side before the server bothers to go back into the kitchen and ask what can be done?  All we got was "No. No. No."  Inflexible and unaccommodating is no way to go through life when you're a Mexican restaurant with food only slightly more interesting than tacqueria food but at 3x the price!

Second inning:  I ordered carne asada and it seemed pretty upscale that they would ask me how I wanted it cooked.  But ... I asked for medium.  It came out not medium, not medium rare, but bloody rare.  Seriously, it looked like only one side was cooked at all because the other side was flat-out raw.  I don't know if the server bobbled my order or if the kitchen forgot to flip the meat.  Either way, pretty lame because it wasn't even a near miss.

Third inning:  We used a Groupon that was to cover the full value of the number of dishes that we ordered.  But they only deducted a smaller amount.  When I pointed it out, the response was that the coupon was only supposed to cover "approximately" the value of those dishes.  We had the coupon right there and showed her that it was not "up to $X" or "approximately" but just for the value of those dishes, period. I don't know what kind of BS this was but I can't believe that they not only tried to rip us off but didn't even back off when they were caught.

That was just the service issues.  Also, the ribs were so overcooked as to be too dry to enjoy.  Bottom line, this place gets an 'F' -- and you know what that stands for!
author: pablo p.

description: Sweet Mexican waiters had time to talk about Mexico  with me, which was nice cause I went there alone.  I LOVED my dish: Cooked just right Chard,  carrot puree and very good  rotisserie chicken that I topped with some fresh salsa fresco, lime, salt and rolled in the hand made tortillas. Boy it was just what I wanted and I was content!  I will return many times with or without a date, when I need nurturing home style Mexican food. (My meal was $20,00, but you pay for what you get, and  I felt like I was eating food that was cooked with care, by people who knew what they were doing. Also the place is super clean, calm and beautiful inside. It was a really relaxing friday night date I had with myself.
author: Sara D.

description:
Me encanta!  Its a high end Mexican place with great service and ambiance.  I was introduced to Regalito through Groupon and will be back often.

Went here right before heading over to the Peter Pan show.  We were a little stressed about getting out in time for the show but the waiter was attentive and got us out right in time!

Things that you must try:
*Chilindrinas- Fresh corn masa and two spinach tortillas, fried and topped with habanero tomato sauce, shredded cabbage, queso fresco, and crema Mexicana.
*Cochinita Pibil-Slow roasted, banana leaf wrapped, citrus and achiote marinated pork; garnished with habanero pickled red onion
*Tacos de Pescado

What was super cool was that the owner emailed me after my visit to make sure I was a satisfied customer.  What a great way to connect with your patrons!
author: Lucy K.

description: I treated both of my sisters to dinner at Regalito as a belated birthday present. It really feels like a family owned and operated joint. The wait staff was so friendly. The food was decadent and delicious while maintaining freshness. I am dying to have a big dinner party on their back patio. So cute!
author: Nicole d.

description:
Came here with a friend, was referred here by a random couple I met out and about in the city.

Being from Texas, I had to put all my Tex-Mex hopes aside and go in with an open mind. I had the Agave Wine Margarita, which was excellent and we shared the Taquitos as an appetizer. I was very excited to see/eat jalapenos in this dish, as the rest of the city seems to be scared of peppers and spice.

For the main course, I had the Tinga de Pollo which was excellent. I don't like beans and this meal only came with rice so that was perfect. I was also served corn tortillas to put my chicken into so that was good as well. I ate it all. Would definitely come back as the ambiance was great. I would also recommend making a reservation on weekend nights as it was busy the whole time we were there.
author: Nancy B.

description:
I want to start this off with a disclaimer that my mom is a cook and my aunt cooks chef quality food. Thus, I have grown up with ridiculously delicious Mexican food. 

That being said, I didn't much enjoy my dining experience here. Maybe those who didn't grow up as I did will have a different opinion.

I had a chicken dish which came with rice, I asked for beans on the side. The chicken was ok, nothing special, the rice was dry, and the beans were good. It came with handmade tortillas which were pretty good. The portion was a good size, I wasn't able to finish it. 

The husb got the fish tacos which he said were good. The presentation was interesting, it looked like a fish stick in a taco. He also said that the coffee was really good.

I like that they have sodas from Mexico (coke in a bottle!). They had some really cool art in there too, good conversation pieces. 

Service was good, we were never empty on coffee or water.

Our meal was around $40. 

This place was not my cup of tea, I'd rather go get a burrito and save some money.
author: gabby m.

description:
We came in on a very busy Saturday night at around 8pm, vainly hoping to squeeze in and use our Groupon. The host estimated it would be about 25 minutes for the bar, then--lucky us!-- was able to seat us in 15. 

Service was friendly and efficient--especially given how busy they were--and we were in and out within an hour (only important because we had somewhere to be afterwards). 

We ordered the Ensalada Nopalitos, Enchiladas Verdes, Tinga de Pollo and two glasses of the Portuguese Rojo, which came to about $60 (yes, you can get even more food for less money at the local taqueria, but that's comparing apples to oranges). The flavors were subtle but by no means bland, i.e. if you're used to Mexican food loaded with salt and cheese, you may be disappointed. Regalito's relies on fresh, sustainable, and locally sources ingredients to flavor its food, which is refreshing and makes for a much better after-dining experience.
author: Sarah S.

description:
KNOW WHAT REGALITO IS BEFORE GOING OR YOU MIGHT BE DISAPPOINTED.  Regalito is NOT a taqueria or typical dirty Mission Mexican joint - its upscale Latino dishes, for an Americanized palette, and an upscale price that comes with it. 

 If you understand this, you might not be so disappointed.  This is a place using high end meats and natural ingredients that are so popular among the hipster AKA douchebag Mission set.  This isnt cheap and dirty El Farolito, this is a nice place you can bring a business client or family from out of town for a sit down meal.  

The food is above average, therefore the 4 star rating.  I had the Cochinita Pibil, which is tasty roasted pork.  My friend had roasted chicken with lime.  Half a chicken for $15 may seem pricey compared to say, El Pollo Supremo , or any taqueria....but isnt much different than NOPA, Zuni Cafe or any other upscale eatery.  And was just as tasty as those places.  We also had the guacamole and elotes (roasted corn) which were both good....not the best we've ever had by a longshot, but above average.

Like many others, we came with a Groupon ($15 for $35 worth of food).  Our total bill came out to about $46, so we only paid $11 plus $15 for the Groupon and tip.  Not a bad deal for a nice dinner.  I will confess I probably would only come back if I had another coupon, but the only reason I would come back at all is because this place has good, if a bit pricey, food.
author: Gmo G.

description: We had a group dinner for the Holidays in their back room and it was perfect.   We were 20 strong and the size of the room provided both space to circulate while also providing a feeling of intimacy.  The food was delicious.  The Chile Colorado was especially good - beautifully seasoned while the guacamole is the best around.  The wait staff was attentive and friendly and with Eduardo leading the charge - we couldn't have been more pleased or well taken care of.  Bravo senores!
author: Travis B.

description:
I brought a groupon for $35 of eats for Mexican food in the Mission. Mexican food in the mission: what could possibly go wrong? 

It went so wrong. It took too long for me to be seated even though the restaurant was empty just before the lunch hour rush. That was a sign of things to come. All-in-all I spent about 1.5 hours there for my three course meal. During the first half an hour, I figured, I wasn't in a rush so I waited it out. A backup server even arrived and I figured when she gave the guy mad attitude that things would speed up. 

Disappointment. Even with the food. 

The tacquitos with chicken were a little bland but good. That alone filled me up. The roast quarter chicken with lime looked really good (she brought me white meat first) but I had to wait for the dark meat I ordered. I started to read the reviews on my phone on yelp and began to understand, this is the way the restaurant is. It's slow. The chicken when it came was sadly disappointing. It was bland. Having to wait for it did not help my disappointment. So I did what one yelper wrote about: I asked for the check and my dessert (which I ordered with all of my other food) at the same time. 

That for whatever reason caused some confusion but I did get both. I've had flan my entire life. I am South American born so I know good flan. That was not good flan. It was hard with too much sugary syrup. 

The bright spot? I got a really full belly for the exact amount of the groupon. I left a tip because that's the way I was raised. 

Will I be going back? No. 

Another weird thing that happened was, a local guitar player/singer came in to entertain the customers but the piped in music was left on. The sounds conflicted with one another and the poor guy got no tips in the end. I couldn't get the waitress in time to break a larger bill.
author: lily l.

description: Not a good sign when a restaurant is empty on a Saturday night. We were a party of 6 and we were hungry so we took a chance. Everyone was very nice and service was very good. I have to say the food was odd and very expensive for what we got.  I ordered the dry, flavorless pork special. The plating was weird too. Slices of pork with some light green sauce on the plate. Not appealing to the eye. The scallops were even weirder. Scallops in a salsa-y broth. We all got a little bowl of black beans. All theses entrees were $18 and $19 dollars. So not worth it. I want to take the cooks on a field trip and show them (and let them taste) some of the great Mexican cooking in the city. I've had more soulful meals at Pancho Villa Taqueria! Take it to the next level guys! I want you to succeed, but at this point I would never seek this food out again. Too many great restaurants to choose from.
author: Sandra W.

description:
After a fun-filled bollywood dance proposal on Pier 39, we headed to the mission on a sunny saturday specifically looking for some kinoko miso at Cha-Ya; turns out it is closed for renovation. The mice in our tummies were screaming and kicking... so we went across the street for some mexican food to Regalito's. 

Overall experience: Just average
Pros:
Nice ambiance
Good Food (Guacamole and cactus salad AND bread pudding
Yummy desserts

Cons:
service was a bit slow
No vegetarian entrees. 
I requested them to remove chicken from the chicken enchilada and after what seemed a rather long wait,I was still served a chicken enchilada... :(

The day was however saved by the arrival of the unique and deliciously decadent mexican style bread pudding...

I would probably go there again for their apps and dezz
author: Kinjal S.

description:
We came here while Carnival was going on, so maybe it's not fair to evaluate their performance on an atypical day. Still, I feel like I have to share my experience here.

There wasn't a wait for a table for three, so it didn't seem like they were totally slammed. They did seem to have only one waitress working, who took our order for drinks and guacamole and then disappeared for a long time before returning with the drinks and to take our orders for food. At least half an hour after putting in our orders she came to tell us that our food would be out soon. 20 minutes later we put some money on the table for the guacamole and lemonade and went to Taqueria Cancun.  I wonder how long it took them to notice we were gone. For the record I've never left a restaurant after ordering before, but they just took so ridiculously long to bring out our food that waiting any longer seemed unreasonable. 

Since I didn't get to eat it, I can't tell you whether their food is any good, but I can tell you that the service is awful. And it seemed way overpriced.
author: Rachel J.

description:
If you're looking for authentic Mexican food just like grandma's cooking, this is the place to go. As soon as you walk in you can smell the wonderful aromas of homemade tortillas, carnitas, poblano chile, and cilantro. Even though the food was all Mexican, the environment had a modern twist to it, but not enough to take away from the traditional representation. 
I had the Papas Con Chorizo which was yummy. The potatoes were cooked with the skin which added a different flavor, and a nice crunch. The chorizo is house made and didn't leave a puddle of grease on my plate. Less fat and grease works for me. 
The place was clean and the service was excellent. I highly recommend it. Check it out!
author: Elizabeth P.

description:
I liked this place. We went on a Monday night so it was pretty slow in there but the staff was attentive but still gave us our space. Manfriend had the Tinga and I had the Enchiladas Rojas, bith were tasty.

B summed it up with "If I was a yelper I would give this place a good review."
author: Kate M.

description:
DELICIOUS!!! Went here for dinner this evening because the line for Delfino was ridiculous as usual. SOO HAPPY I DID!!!

I had the cactus salad to start and the Chile Rellenos for me entree and to finish shared the warm bread pudding.. everything was sooo delicous. Great Mexican flavors accompanied by a great margarita!

Service was amazing and the weather was soo awesome we enjoyed a perfect dinner outside.

I will be back!!
author: Helen B.

description: I stopped in here between the busy lunch and dinner shifts, and was treated like royalty.  Great ambiance!  The food was wonderfully delicious!  I got the chicken enchiladas.  The salsa was hot and amazing!  Highly, highly recommended!!
author: Becky K.

description: Fresh and delicious Mexican food. Awesome guacamole.
author: Anouchka V.

description:
I recently bought a discount deal from Groupon for this restaurant, so I went there to check them out with a friend.

Interior is really modern and clean.  They have a separated section in the back with a big communal table. 

All servers were extremely friendly and nice.  

Food.... it was meh..... We ordered a grilled cactus dish (I forgot the name) and it was interesting but it didn't have much taste.  The best part of the meal was the guacamole we got for free because the server apparently misordered it for another table.  The guacamole and chips were really good.  For entrees, we had braised short rib and enchiladas.  I didn't find them tasty at all... The short rib was very salty but not flavorful.  The enchiladas didn't have much taste either...  We were very full from the guacamole that we hardly touched them (and they were not tasty, so we were not encouraged to eat them).  

We had $50 worth of coupon and ended up paying about $30 extra including tax and tip.  It was definitely not worth spending $40 per person.  Even with the deal, we basically paid a little over $30 per person.

Their food is just 2 stars, but because of the nice servers, I will give 3.
author: M S.

description:
This. restaurant. is. incredible. I've had what seems like several hundred mexican dishes in my life, but the flavor delivered at this place was phenomenal. Absolute tops. The guac is creamy and delicious, my entree was like little bites of heaven. Never wanted it to end. 

And the sangria? Ohhhhh the sangria. Many places I've noticed don't really know how to balance the flavors in sangria well, but Regalito has it down to a science. 

I had no problems with service, we were seated immediately and the meal proceeded with no problems. Watch out for the serenading mexican men that shake their tip cups at you. Two of them entered the restaurant at separate times during our meal. Poor second guy had to be turned away. Adds to the ambiance.

Loved this place, will be back very soon!
author: Maureen C.

description:
Service was impeccable. The Chicken with mole is scrumptious - i was a bit tentative to try given I didn't know how chicken infused with a chocolate sauce along with mexican herbs and spices would taste - but totally worth it.  One of the best meals I have ever had.  Will definitely go back. 

I highly highly recommend this place and dish.
author: K P.

description:
No seating for 2 people at the Tables yet everyone else had 2 people at a Table. Had to sit at Counter in a supposed upscale restaurant & stare at a Citrus juicer. I had Carne Asada which was very salty served w/ bland roasted potatoes ( I gave to my hungry friend) laying in a enchilada sauce w/ a few Grilled green onions $19! Took forever to get a very disappointing meal. 
I would like to have talked to the owner about my meal & experience..etc.. for his own good but no good deed goes unpunished. 
Regalito's are you listening?
author: Sparky W.

description:
This is a good back up when you don't want to wait 1-2 hours for Delfina.

What we ordered:
Chips and fresh salsa
Chicken enchiladas verde
Chipotle shredded chicken
Carne asada
Trout fish special
Sangria

The service was a bit spotty.  They took their time coming to get our order, but they were nice so, fine.

The chips were good, but the salsa was overloaded with onions.  It was tasty but onions give me heartburn (unfortunately) so I had to pick around them....it was good though!

Chipotle shredded chicken was obliterated by my husband.  I blinked and it was all gone.  I did get a taste and I liked it because the chipotle wasn't overpowering.

My chicken enchiladas verde was OK.  Nothing special.

I do have to say they skimp on the rice and beans - which were really good - so I would like to see a bigger portion next time.

My friend said the carne asada was on the border of being over cooked but said it was still tasty...they need to watch the flame on the beef.

The trout special was a whole trout with salsa spread over - my friend really liked it but the portion seemed tiny.

Considering the neighborhood, the prices were a bit high for the portion sizes.
author: S K.

description:
Disappointing dining experience. From what I gather from reviews here, their golden years ended abruptly with a change of kitchen staff. Awful, undersized dishes with a price tag that'd feed my entire social circle (better) at any taqueria in the area. 

[Side note: Sorry, but no bonus points for good chips, salsa and sangria. This is the Mission. That's a skill cultivated by near to everyone here.]
author: Janett R.

description:
I have to agree with the other reviewers that found the food tasteless.  Went on Valentine's Day, and despite the fact that I and my dining companion ordered completely different dishes, both of us found the food to be bland to the point of ascetic.  

I ordered the pork shoulder and he ordered the roasted chicken.    Both tasted as if someone had just heated the meat up, put it on a plate and let it speak for itself.  Well, it didn't have very much to say.  Although my pork was somewhat livened by the serrano peppers it was sauteed with, it was not even salted or peppered. 

The vegetables that came with our meal were not much different.  After dinner, my companion was unfavorably comparing his meal to the roasted chickens at Costco.  What does that tell you?  They were not the sort of entrees that you would expect for the $17-18 price tag. 

We also had to wait upwards of 25 minutes for our meals.   I'm going to make a wild guess that the chef called in sick that night (which explains the meal) and one of the servers was commandeered to take over kitchen duties (which explains the service).  In view of the positive reviews from other people, I strongly suspect that you will have better luck on a better night.  I wish I could guarantee it.   .
author: Bill C.

description:
Was out in the Mission trying to find a good dinner spot for a group of 5 on a Thursday night. They were able to seat us right away since it was not busy. We ordered the Sangria which was good and shared dishes family style. 

The Taquitos de Papas y Queso were really good for apps. The  Pollo Con Mole Negro was my favorite entree. The chicken was really good and flavorful. We could not get enough of the mole sauce - the plate was wiped clean! We also ordered the Enchiladas Verdes and the Chile Relleno - the Chile Relleno was just okay. It was smothered in cheese so the flavor of the vegetables was lost on me. 

For dessert, we shared the Churros and Flan - not mind-blowing but still really good. Overall, good, yummy food, though the service was kind of slow which was a little disappointing.
author: Amy N.

description:
This place is phenomenal, especially for anyone else like me, who is gluten intolerant: ALL of the entrees are gluten free! IT's amazing.

The cuisine is creative, tasty and healthy. I had the Chile Renellos (sp?), and my friend has the Enchiladas Rojas. Both were delicious! The desserts looked fantastic, but both my friend and I were too full to try any ;) 

This place is a little on the small and dark side, but it felt warm by Mana playing in the background and the accommodating, friendly staff tending to our questions.
author: Deirdre P.

description:
Come here for OUTSTANDING sangrias.

I've since ordered sangrias at other places, in hopes of replicating my experience here--but to no avail. 

I ordered their cochinita pibil. The food was definitely fresh, but a little bland for my tastes. Pork was a bit tough, too, as it arrived over-cooked.   

That said, they do deliver on ambiance. The open kitchen and clean wooden decor does promote a sense of community and hominess. Service, too, was very friendly. I believe our waitress was the owner or manager, and she was just a bundle of joy happened upon warmth and a smile.
author: Anna L.

description:
Based on the number of positive reviews on El Farolito, I went there first to try some great Mexican food in SF.  However, I thought the carne asada burrito I had there was just average (in my opinion).  So I went out on a limb to try Regalito Rosticeria last evening, and was amazed by what I got there...

First - the service was outstanding!  
Second - the carnitas were AMAZING!  The pork was chunky and braised.  Super juicy and flavorful.  They came with whole pintos, a chunky salsa fresca with jalapeno, and sliced avocado.  And the homemade corn tortillas were to-die-for.  Not greasy.  Just perfect.  And they topped it off with a spicy habanero salsa.  
Third - any place that serves Victoria beer is already starting off ahead of the rest.  (Although El Farrolito served it too...to be fair.)

Anyways...loved the food SO much.  Yes, it was slightly expensive, but this place is not a taqueria serving average tacos & burritos.  It's beautifully prepared food.   The time & effort the cook was spending on plating the food was nice to see.  It was interesting sitting at the bar watching as they made everything.  I'd definitely recommend it to anyone wanting awesome food.
author: Leah S.

description:
I will admit I came in with a bias against... upscale Mexican in a neighborhood where there are as many taquerias as there are hipsters on fixies... tough sell to *this* taqueria lover!

We came for brunch, and luckily I was in the mood for breakfasty stuff, because (as mentioned by other reviewers) there are no vegetarian lunch entrees.  I had been thinking about chilaquiles all week, so there was no question what I was going to order.  It was kinda different, maybe slightly deconstructed (oh lord!) with the egg cooked separately in a fluffy omlette like thing on top of the chips and sauce.  Though this preparation led to a highly superior texture in the egg, I did miss the messy mix of it all being scrambled together.  The chile verde sauce was AMAZING though!!  My friend's juevos ranceros were gone before I even got a good look, and my other friend's chicken mole negra was also well received.  The guac was ok.  The flan was yummy but nothing special, bread pudding was good.  

I have to say the service was superior!  My friends brought their baby and 
the staff were very accommodating and very attentive overall.   

Food:  Pretty Good
Service: Excellent
Price: Woah Nellie!  It is not your mama's taqueria!
Return Visit:  Not out of the question but probably not.
author: Linda L.

description:
I really want to like Regalito because I appreciate the effort, but the food keeps missing the mark. I came twice, first tried the roasted chicken and today I had the tinga de pollo. Both meals were not memorable, they are missing something, more flavor. The prices are expensive for the food and portion size. 
Being that the food is simply ok, I wouldn't go back and pay $16 per dish.
author: Mrs. G.

description:
The churro at the end was delish and came with hot chocolate. My dinner was tasty but not particularly memorable. Sangria was great!

I think perhaps its downside is that it is pricey and the food doesn't match that. My friend and I ate here for 65$ or so. That is one Sangria, one soda, two entree's, an appetizer and a dessert. Fortunately we had a groupon and only paid 30$. It was not worth 60$ so I probably wont go back.

ATMOSPHERE AND service are both great! :)
author: Bronwen H.

description:
Definitely OK. food was decent. not bad, but not mind blowing amazing like some restaurants in the hood. mole chicken was tender, tasty. sangria was BOMB though.. for sure, get a pitcher of that. 

service though, was absolutely INCREDIBLE. i think our guy's name was Jose? if i'm mistaken then i'll come back to correct, but really.. he was great. super nice, knowledgeable, patient, and most importantly.. attentive. the bf & i feel like we get forgotten about more often than not at a restaurant (why? i don't know.. forgettable faces? seem too nice to complain?), but this guy was fab. big ups to him for that.
author: Yui K.

description: Nasty, Nasty, Nasty! Maybe we r spoiled for living in So. Cal but my goodness th is place stinks so so bad.
author: Ross J.

description:
Chicken mole is a dish that can go one of two ways: REALLY BAD or REALLY GOOD.  Thank goodness Regalito's version is absolutely fantastic! 

My boyfriend and I decided to come here to have a nice semi-fancy dinner for our Friday date night in the mission.  The minute I saw "Chicken Mole" on the menu, I knew that this was the place we had to go to.  We both ordered the tortilla soup - which was pretty yummy!  Fresh avocados and crunchy tortilas = yum.  

My bf ordered the Tinga and I got the mole.  His dish wasn't too shabby, but it definitely could not compare to mine.  I received a nice half chicken that was roasted and covered in their amazing mole sauce.  It wasn't too thick or too thin - it was JUST right :) The chicken itself was moist and tender - not over cooked or dry.  

We also ordered some dessert - churros con chocolate.  I grew up eating this delectable treat as a kid, so I was looking forward to trying their version.  The churros themselves were spectacular - crunch outside, soft inside, all covered in cinnamon-sugar.  I wasn't too impressed with the hot chocolate though, I thought it was going to be thicker, it was just a regular hot cocoa.  

This is definitely going to be one of our "go-to" spots from here on out.  You should definitely try it too.
author: Cherlyn M.

description: Big disappointment! The dishes are small and the prices are  exorbitant. The service is OK. The web site menu is not all accurate neither in prices or selections. I was craving the Mole Negro and it wasn't on the menu. We had the Papas con Rajas appetizer to share (get your own, too small to share) and they were  tasty although for almost $8 not worth it.The tortillas were served more to the cold side than the warm side and stale.The Pork Ribs, 2 out of the 4 little tiny ones,  were almost burnt to the bone. The tortillas used for the Enchiladas Verdes tasted undercooked. However, the  Capirotada dessert, was yummy. The owners must reconsider the prices and once in a while check the food for quality control.
author: Maribel G.

description: Unbelievably delicious food, top notch service - at a very reasonable price.  Can't wait to return (and I'll be returning from Menlo Park  - that is how much I love it)
author: Meg G.

description:
Regalito indeed!  My best bud had a Groupon for a shared appetizer, two entrees and a shared dessert.  From the first to last moment our waitress had a huge smile that comes from deep within...even when we told her we had a Groupon!   I think she just may be one of the best waitresses/waiters I have ever had.  The only waiters and waitresses that compare are the ones that used to work at the now defunct Carnelian Room. 

Food!  We had the Chicharones, Enchiladas, Pork Shoulder and Bread Pudding.  Oh baby!  I'm not big on Chicharones...yeah...I know...most lOvE them!  However, these were AmAzzzing!  They were mostly small cubes of pork fat with a few pieces of super crunchy skin surrounded by pickled carrots and onions.  OMG!  The pork fat cubes (does that sound disgusting?!)  were magic in my mouth.  One of the best things I have ever had.  The skin...good..but a little too hard.   My friend's enchiladas were tasty...however MY (mine!) pork shoulder was quite tender and uniquely flavored.  I had to say "Wow" after the first bite.  My friend helped me figure out the flavor...which she said is traditional...orange!  After she told me..I could not stop tasting the orange!  It actually made the pork taste gamier than usual..but in a good way.  They serve it with perfectly cooked beans (not re-fried) and corn tortillas!  Delicious.  The bread pudding was what my friend wanted, not my favorite dessert...especially not plain bread pudding with lots of huge almonds and raisins.  Hmmm...I LOVE dessert! However...let her have most of it.   Awesome service and really delish food!  They have a newly opened..and lovely outdoor seating (heated!) area.
author: Delicious B.

description:
I tried dining here once before when I was REALLY hungry.  After enduring a reasonable wait (we had no reservations), we were seated at the counter.  This afforded me the opportunity to watch some great tortilla making, as well as food being prepared with fresh ingredients.   I enjoyed having the kitchen right across from the counter, as I am somewhat of a culinary voyeur.  But, after waiting over 20 minutes and never being acknowledged by anyone, my stomach told me that I should come back when I could wait a while without getting sick.  Yes, they lost my business to a less posh but totally delicious Mission restaurant.

I returned to Regalito last night (a Thursday) in order to redeem a Groupon that I bought after my initial visit.  This time, I packed my patience.  When I arrived, we were quoted a 15 minute wait time- reasonable.  

We killed the first 15 minutes doing some produce shopping in the neighborhood.  The next 15 minutes were spent sitting outside.  We chatted with some guests that were dining at one of their outdoor tables about their fear that the server had abandoned them- yikes!  This prompted us to check on our status.  The server inside said that  it would be a few more minutes and she would try to get us a table *wink/nudge*.  Literal wink.  As though we are getting the insider VIP treatment.

But alas, I packed my patience.  More importantly, I packed my Groupon that was already paid for!  Nothing was going to make me leave.  Within 10 minutes after receiving the "wink-of-assurance", we were seated at a table.  YAY!  

The inside of the restaurant was very warm and welcoming.  It is quite cozy (small), so discussing top secret info might be risky.  I could clearly hear everything that the table 6 inches away from mine was saying.  

On to the food!  We split two appetizers and two entrees.  To start: Guacamole con Tostados and the Taquitos de Pollo.  It was pretty cool watching the guacamole and tostados being made to order.  My only criticism is that the guacamole was pretty bland.  It lacked acidity and any level of complexity in flavor.  Pretty much tasted like delicious avocado mushed with a few tomatoes here and there.  I really liked the Taquitos de Pollo- crispy, densely packed with pollo, fresh flavors.

I asked the server for recommendations for our entrees.  She said we should definitely try the Cochinita Pibil, which is citrus and achiote marinated pork wrapped in a banana leaf served with habanero and pickled onions.  HELL YEAH!  Sounds like a party on my palate.  The other recommendations that she gave were Tacos de Pescado and Enchiladas Verdes.  Since the fish of the say was arctic char, I went with the fish tacos.  

Unfortunately when our entrees were to come out, the server only brought the Tacos de Pescado and informed us that the restuarant was out of the Cochinita de Pebil.  "No big deal, I will get the enchiladas verdes", I told the server.  But I was really pretty bummed.  The pork dish really sounded interesting.  

The fish tacos were quite good.  Again, the homemade tortillas come into play.  The fish tasted fresh and was cooked perfectly.  By the time we finished the fish tacos, the enchiladas were being delivered to the table.  The kitchen did a good job of getting the new entree out asap.  

The enchiladas were just ok.  The chicken inside was bland.  And the enchiladas were more like folded chicken tacos with a fine chunky salsa verde instead of a smooth green enchilada sauce on top along with some onion, queso fresco and crema.  I really would not recommend this dish. 

Overall, the food was hit and miss.  The service was much better on my second visit, but I can't speak to the consistency of service.  I think that the people outside felt abandoned because there was really only one server and a food runner attending to all of the tables in the restaurant.   If you plan on dining here, get a reservation and know that the service may be slower.  The food is more expensive than your average Mission restaurant, but if you care about eating fresh authentic food or ambiance (which I value much less) the price is pretty reasonable.  

Will I be back?  I have to.  I have one more Groupon!
author: Floyd R.

description:
Regalito is solidly good. We had super delicious food. I ordered the Chile Relleno, a vegetarian stuffed pepper dish that came with very fresh, very hot habanero salsa and delicious pinto beans. 

Yes, the costs are higher than other Taqueria's in the area - that's because they offer something different and better. The food is high quality - all the beef and pork are Niman Ranch and the chicken is hormone and antibiotic free. They are also doing sit down dining and offering interesting menu options. Many of the other Taquerias do a ton of their business from take out food and don't offer a comparable ambiance to Regalito. 

The service was so great. Our waitress was really smiley and friendly and was very helpful in explaining the background of the different dishes. Many of their dishes are based on the style of cooking in the Yucatan peninsula.

Best of all - I have been meaning to try this place out for ages but just never got around to it until I saw that my Green Zebra 2010 book had a buy one entree get one free. What a deal!
author: Kelly S.

description:
Bacon-wrapped hot dog this is *not*.

It seems counter-intuitive to be in the 'Mission and pay more than $8 for a filling, scrumptious & affordable Mexican culinary fix.  It also seems counter-intuitive to be in the 'Mission and pay more than $8 for a filling, scrumptious & affordable dosa *meal*, yet I find myself time and time again @ Dosa.

So for that days when you want a little more attention to your meal's presentation, when you want your water re-filled after it reaches one sip level down, when you want:

- taquitos con papas y queso (decandence squared)
- pollo con mole negro (& the pollo slips off the bone like a skinny strap over a shoulder)
- enchiladas rojas (that will make your vegetarian dinner companion happy)
- a glass of sangria (that may not be the best, but doesn't taste like it came out of a box either)
- a chilled glass (who does that anymore?!) of Pacifico
- CHOCO FLAN (omg omg omg omg)
(price total: $63.00 for 2 people - tip not included)

 -- when you want all the above, in a simple, fun decor that isn't plastered with Frida paintings accompanied with friendly service AND LEFTOVERS FOR LUNCH THE NEXT DAY (!!!)

...give yourself and a buddy a little/ (but not-really-so-little in terms of price or portions) gift ~ Regalito!
author: Anjali V.

description:
Review based on my last experience using OpenTable. Though, I've been here once before when they first opened and I liked the food, this last time was a disaster.

OpenTable should review their policies regarding what type of restaurants are able to participate with OpenTable. Regalito should be more of a "order from the counter, be given a number, they deliver the food to your table" kind of place.

They don't have a host - The cook came out from behind the counter and sat people regardless of whether anyone in line had a reservation. When we finally got sat, they didn't even look up my name to check me in even though I told them we had reservations.

They are poorly staffed - Just one waitress for the entire restaurant. Once sat, we waited about 5-10 minutes before we were given water by someone from the kitchen. The waitress never came over even though the kitchen staff kept saying that the waitress would be right with us. After sitting for 25-30 minutes and no waitress, we got up and left.

This place doesn't deserve to be on OpenTable, especially without the staff (i.e. a proper host, additional wait staff, etc.) that they need to run a busy restaurant.
author: Rolo T.

description:
Unfortunately, I'm disappointed in this place.  My dear friend K is quite the foodie and had read some great recommendations for here.  We made reservations for early on a Thursday.  We were one of the few people in the restaurant at that time but service was still slow.  The atmosphere is OK but other than some interesting wall art (which you will have plenty of time to look at) its nothing amazing.

All that aside, everything can be forgiven if the food is great and this food... it was merely edible.  I'm talking bland folks.  I got the mole and it tasted like "Denny's American Diner does Mole".  Very unflavorful.  I kept searching for something with kick or interest in the whole plate but it was a dud.  I kept it to myself for a while then saw K just kind of poking at her food too.... another dud.  Two meals, totally mediocre.  We didn't finish, definitely didn't get to-go boxes and left to find something else worth the calories to fill us up.

On the a positive note, although slow the service is friendly.  I left something in the restaurant when we left and the waitress came out to give it to me.  Also, their Sangria is VERY tasty... just don't come on an empty stomach :)
author: Michelle B.

description: Great Mexican joint. Got myself a burrito here and it was great. Fairly priced and the place was clean which is a major plus for me. Lots of bang for your buck that's for sure.
author: Jose D.

description:
I really enjoyed this place. There was a 20min wait on Friday at 7:00, so plan ahead. Although they did callus so that we could go to a bar and wait. We ordered the guacamole(9$) and it was so yummy. i would recommend this to anyone. The dishes were not very large and strange, but quite delish. The enchiladas were good, but not your standard. It was basically tortillas rolled with all the stuffing and sauce on top. we mixed in the beans and rice(Those are so good) and this was an amazing dish. We also order the chile Relleno, i loved this dish, i was very well made.

ALL-N-ALL: I liked it, the total cost was a surprisingly more expensive then i thought. but worth it every once in a while!!
author: Heather P.

description: Vegetarians (like myself) beware!  There's only one entree and two appetizers that are vegetarian.  That said, my enchiladas rojas were divine!  Homemade corn tortillas that melt in your mouth, stuffed with lots of vegetables and topped with smoky red sauce.
author: Sona P.

description:
The food is always good and the ambiance/atmosphere is usually good.

I was disappointed about my last visit as they sat me next to a noisy baby when other tables were open. Oh well - life. 

If you're looking for something new, this place will not disappoint you.
author: Bill H.

description:
Decent, average....  I had brunch here on Sunday morning with a couple pals.  There was nobody in the restaurant but yet the service was really slow.  Everything was ok, I was satisfied but I won't come all the way to the mission for this place.  I'd rather go to Luna Park or Frjtz that are right around the corner.  The decor is nice, lots of orange and very fresh looking.  I had the rotisserie chicken which was decent enough.  Nothing special.  My friends had the chorizo and the huevos rancheros.  Not sure why but the waitress brought the huevos rancheros totally undercooked and asked if it was ok.  If it was ok you probably didn't have to ask, had to get sent back to cook the right way.  Makes no sense to me.  

Redeeming quality: the guacomole was really great!  I loved the round chips they give you with them.  

A little pricey for brunch for 3.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
AMBIENCE:

Regalito is a small, simple restaurant.  It has a fast-food/taqueria feel to it (open kitchen area right next to the seats), but the prices are more expensive than a taqueria ($16/entrees).  The artwork on the walls is nice, but I personally wanted a more "fine-dining" feel for the prices I was paying.  

We also had a large group (brthday party ~12-14 people), and the service was VERY slow.  The restaurant could not accomodate all of us at one table, so some of us had to sit at the bar.  

There was a live mariachi singer who sang us Happy Birthday, but I think he was a free agent (not hired by the restaurant).

FOOD:
The tortilla chips & guacamole & salsa for appetizers were decent, not out-of-this-world.  The guacamole was a tad bland. 
I got the chicken con mole negro, which is poached chicken with mole sauce, rice & beans on the side.  The entire dish was pretty bland, average for Mexican food in the Bay Area (I've been to some hole-in-the wall places that had much tastier food).  The portions are hearty though, and the mole sauce was good.

Overall, I give this place 3 stars.  It was decent enough for a lunch place, but not a place I would take a date or friends on a night out.
author: Bee M.

description: I found out about this place through a deal I purchased on Groupon. It's a small trendy Mexican restaurant in the heart of the Mission district. For the Groupon, we got to pick one appetizer, two entrees and a dessert. The guacamole was great, and I definitely recommend the ribs. The chicken was not bad, but we've had better sangria elsewhere. The portions were also small for what's an average of $17-20 per dish. We finished off with bread pudding which was also pretty good. Overall I thought the experience was quite positive; upscale mexican with great service in a trendy setting, though at upscale prices also.
author: Allen L.

description: The food is bland -- the calabacita tamale, the salmon tacos -- screaming for flavor.  I'm all for upscale treatments of ethnic cuisines, but here the ambience outweighs the food.
author: Vanessa H.

description:
I feel bad for everyone who went to Regalito and expected a taqueria experience. Regalito is a wonderful, small, local (hardcore local too: the owner lives just a few blocks away) restaurant making great food that would be far too much trouble to make at home.

The carne con chilie colorado was outstanding - with spiced, full flavored stewed beef; the refritos; and the warm, freshly made thick tortillas. The spice builds and was spot on in intensity. It is not for the weak of palate.

I could have eaten a plate of just the beans, rice, and ranchero sauce accompanying the chile relleno de calabazas y maiz and left happy, but luckily for me there was all that cheese and perfectly cooked veggies. It even pleased a couple of meat-eaters.

Wine by the bottle choices are reasonable and pair well with the food too. We had a red from Uraguay - a fun change of pace.

I can't wait for the height of corn season so I can dig into their elote.

With all entrees under $20, Regalito is a crazy bargain for the quality.
author: Lauren G.

description:
Atmosphere is soothing: Lime Green and Yellow Palette Walls. Tortilla is made by hand. Mango Azucar with Mexican Vanilla Ice Cream was DELICIOUS!

Habanero Hot Sauce is to die for. Had two and a half jars.
author: Shih Fa K.

description:
Thank god for groupon bc the food we ate was not worth the $50 that we wouldve spent. Food was ok UNTIL I found a hair in my pico de gallo and the inside of my chicken was pink. 

Thankfully, the waiter took my meal off the check! 

Wouldn't go back!!!
author: Monica N.

description: This was our first experience and it was excellent!  We went on the "Pigalito" Tuesday and were rewarded with a great meal.  I had the chipotle ribs and my girlfriend had the carnitas.  The ribs were falling off the bone tender with a nice kick from the spice rub. The carnitas were truly fork tender.  The best we have ever had, north and south of the border.  We will be back to work our way through the menu.
author: Rob F.

description:
I would give this a 3.5 Star but, since that option isn't available, I will round up. 

My dishes: 
Guacamole con Tostadas - MMMMM 
Enchiladas Verdes - Very nicely done, I really enjoyed the presentation as well as the dish itself. 

My friend had a chicken dish that was a good dish but, nothing special about it. I don't even remember which one it was but, the sauce was lacking that little bit on ooomph that would have caught my attention. 

I also, really liked the decor and design of the place and the staff was very friendly and attentive. I will go back.
author: Brian R.

description:
Regalito is an "upscale" Mexican restaurant complete with bright lights, good art and decor.  

Despite living 2 blocks away, Mister B and I had never checked out Regalito because we love our taquerias and their prices!  Then a certain coupon site offered $25 gc for only $10, so I swooped (hehe).  

Tonight we redeemed the coupon, and while it was a *nice* experience and some hits with the foodage, I'm just not sure I want to pay those prices (chips and salsa for $4, c'mon!) for food of equal or lesser quality than aforementioned cheap taquerias.  Let's just say that I should have purchased two coupons.

We decided to spring for the chips and salsa, which turned out to be really good.  I liked the v. crispy fried whole corn tortillas I got to break into whatever sizes I liked for dipping into the fresh salsa.  We also ordered the papas con chorizo which was awesome, very flavorful---chorizo was not really that fatty.  

I tried my equivalent of a barometer for any decent mexican resto, which was enchiladas rojas.  the sauce was lovely looking and smelled good.  When I tasted it, I wanted more salt, more heat, and more richness.  I was also sad that I got pintos over refritos, because that's my food crack.  The rice was nice.

Mister B got his fave, carnitas.  They were well marinated and had great flavour, though overall lacking in salt as well as the presentation.

Service is great.  And it's a really nice place to eat, as in clean and interesting.  

I will probably wait for another coupon for a return visit.
author: Aimee B.

description: Lacking in flavor, over-priced, small-portioned. Lackluster experience overall. Skip.
author: Sara H.

description:
I've walked by this restaurant for the past few years and have always been intrigued.  We finally ventured in today for an early dinner.  And what an absolute treat! 

The attentive service was amazing all the way around. And the food was equally delicious. The sopa was too spicy for the toddler but she loved the housemade tortillas and refried beans!  

Based on our server's recommendation, I ordered the Tinga de Pollo. This dish did not disappoint! Served with a bowl of rice, the shredded chicken offered a balanced combo of light/dark meat atop an avocado salsa and chipotle sauce. The light and fruity 2009 Monte Pinot Noir paired nicely.

I can't believe it's taken me this long to try this place. I'll definitely be back!
author: M G.

description: Went to Regalito tonight with a larger group (13 people). Food was great and the service was excellent. Totally appreciated the experience and would recommend. Also nice to have bar menu options for those that didn't want to spend the $$ on the entrees.
author: Reed D.

description:
I came upon this place while walking from the not yet opened Mr Pollo to Tartine and this place grabbed my nose like I was a friggin toucan (Sam). Unable to think for myself, I helplessly entered and soon found myself seated at the bar. 

Initial impressions, aside from the amazing smell: The space is on the smaller side and has lots of character. Open kitchen with bar seating watching the action and table seating to the side. Lively colors and colorful artwork drape the walls. I likes. 

The service staff is super friendly and before long I began chatting with one of the service staff. I discovered that I was 3.5 yrs late in discovering this place and it is family owned. I also found out that every Tuesday the restaurant procures a whole 200 lb pig and roasts it. Carnitas. Chicarrones. Pork belly. Todos. Is your mouth watering yet? Mine is.

Before I go into what went down, I would like give much love to the little Mexican lady making the hand-made corn tortillas (read: FTMFW). 

Contrary to standard operating procedures when trying a new eatery, gf and I ordered only 1 plate a piece, thanks to the 1 hr limit on the parking meter. What went down:

Enchiladas de pollo - Good (but not great). Hand made tortillas really make the dish and the salsa verde is very tasty, if not a bit on the tart side. Also topping the dish were crema, queso fresco, and of course, cilantro y cebollas. Served with pinto beans and well seasoned rice (you know, the orange kind). 

COCHINITA PIBIL - A must-try-dish. I think this is the thing that grabbed my nose. It's pork wrapped in banana leaf and stewed with cocaine and magical fairy dust (disclaimer: not really cooked with cocaine and magical fairy dust). The color is a deep red and the flavor is phenomenal, thanks to the 5-6 hrs of stewing in a pot. Served w/ black beans, pickled red onion and tortillas. Unbelievable.  

I missed out on the special of the day, which was Mexican pork chops (as it was explained to me). Learn from my mistake: find out the daily special before committing to regular fare off of the menu.


ATTN Snooty-Poos: This restaurant is very clean. Absence of sticky floors/surfaces. Approved for your dining experience.
author: Kenneth L.

description:
I have been wanting to go here for a while since its in my neighborhood and looks cute. My BF recently bought a groupon online, so yesterday we finally had an excuse to check this place out. 

Overall, we had a positive experience here. I think the biggest selling point is that everything is made incredibly fresh. We watched a woman make our tortillas by hand and when they came to our table they were absolutely delicious. We watched the chef prepare all of our food and, having worked in a restaurant, I was impressed with the quality and freshness of everything that came to our plate. 

Here is the rundown:

I had the roast chicken - This was good, but honestly, not as good as Limon Rotisserie down the street. If I come here again, I probably will order a different entree. The greens were very flavorful though. 

BF had the roasted pork shoulder - This was amazingly tender and flavorful. Definitely worth trying. 

We shared the guacamole - Good, but its the rare place in CA where you get crappy guac. 

The service was not anything to write home about, but it was fine. Bottom line, worth a shot if you want fresh flavorful Mexican-inspired food thats a step up from traditional taqueria fare.
author: Blond E.

description:
Awesome awesome authentic mexican food.  Place has been on my list to try, and when a deal via SecondServing came up, I just had to get 5 of my close friends to join me.  Chile Verde was the best. Yum!

We came on Pigalito night, and if you love pork, it's the place to be which happens every Tuesday.  We tried all of their main dishes,  to be exact, and every dish had its own personality.  Perfect balance with each course.  Definitely coming back here again.!
author: Francis L.

description:
Just wandered across this place using the GPS and Yelp app on my phone...
And no wait at 9pm on a Saturday, in the Mission! 
Great staff! Even brought us more tostada chips without having to ask. 
And by far the BEST chicken mole in the city!!

**Been back twice since my original visit. And still is great!

***And just a follow up to everyone who's saying it's expensive and over-priced, comparing it to the neighborhood taquerias...
I quote from Regalito's website-
"We are committed to using organic, local, and sustainable foods whenever possible."
This is not easy or cheap for them to do! If you don't care how your food is raised or grown then stick to your cheap Mexican. Trust me you don;t want to know where it's been or coming from. 
A little more money for peace of mind and fresh food is always worth it!!
author: O. S.

description: Very polite staff, and a quiet atmosphere. We tried both green and red enchiladas and they were both amazing. The quality of food is high, and so is their service. I would definitely recommend for anyone esp if someone has heightened food allergies... someone in our group has celiac, and the food was totally fine without substitutions.
author: Chayne J.

description: The ambiance was really nice. The kitchen was like the bar and the bright colors were engaging. I got the Mole Chicken which was good. It only came with a little side of rice which was disapointing since the portions aren't huge like you would imagine with Mexican restaurants. My dish was around $13. The salsa fresca was pretty chunky and good and came with tostadas which was a nice touch.
author: Joleen Q.

description: After not hearing back I decided to go back an in an talk to the manager. I explained what happened, showed him the receipt my credit card statement.  He apologized that I had to come in twice and credited my credit card the difference.  I'm upping to 3 stars for service.  While waiting I was watching them cook tortillas.  They do use quality ingredients and good technique but I still think their foods is missing a certain depth of flavor that should be there.
author: Shane C.

description:
[Green Zebra Coupon: Buy one, get on free entree OR 50% off one entree]

I don't know how to explain how great the food here is. Their gimmick is "traditional Mexican market foods" but it doesn't quite taste like that -- it's better.

A little more expensive than your average Tex-Mex and all your taco and burrito lovers will have to try something new here.

I can't really comment on their service since I got take out but while I was waiting for my to-go bag the waiter there offered me a seat at the counter and refilled my water about 5 times.
author: Elena C.

description:
Came to Regalito on a whim last Sunday at 5ish with my parents, aunt, cousin and boyfriend once we realized we had no shot in hell of getting into Delfina. They were very accommodating to us putting us in our own corner in the small space they have. 

I like the minimal atmosphere of the place, but need to discuss the plastic chairs with the suction-cup bottoms...talk about annoying! Its a concrete-like floor so you're not slipping around too much but when you do WANT to get up or even shift your chair you have to battle the suction cups..annoying. 

We ordered the guacamole and tostadas, and when we ate the first bunch of tostadas they brought out more, fresh, hot and crunchy. The salsa and thier guacamole is literally to-die-for and although there were some onion chunks it was not overpowering...its nice to taste the fresh ingredients.

I come from a family of "Mexican food" lovers..i.e. burritos, tacos, enchiladas etc. but Regalito is legit "food from Mexico" so that was a nice change of pace. We ordered 3 Tinga de Pollos (me, bf and aunt), 2 Enchiladas Verdes (cousin and dad) and 1 Pollo Regalito. 

The wait for the food was much longer that I would have expected just because there weren't many people in the place when we ordered, but we did have the guac to hold us over and good company. 

Everyone enjoyed their food to an extent...the Enchiladas Verdes came out luke-warm and my dad and cousin asked for them to be re-heated, the Pollo Tringa was good, not great, and MUCH spicier than expected. When we asked the waitress she told us it wasn't spicy at all, I think she didnt realizing she was talking to a bunch of Irish people who can't handle spice. Tip:: order some sour cream and all will be good. Mom loved the Pollo Regalito and took half home. 

I wouldn't come back with a large group, but for a lunch or casual dinner, yes, but be prepared to be there a while.
author: Alissa C.

description: Pretty decent! Came here with a Groupon. Higher end, meat-heavy, expensive. Not the most notable.
author: Mandy H.

description: Had dinner here the other night. This place is small but cute. We had made reservations not sure if it was necessary since the place never seemed to be at capacity but probably better to plan ahead. We had the squash appetizer which sounded a bit weird --but was delicious! We also had the roasted chicked and the mole dish. Both were very good.
